Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Reed said it'd be weeks till --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He couldn't generate enough power for the machine to reach critical mass. Yet another mistake for "Mr. Fantastic."
What?: And you can? Power it up?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'll be watching over you.
What?: Just get back soon, or I start looking for a new groom.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Soon as I'm back, I'm gonna trade that in for a bigger rock.
What?: I don't care about rocks, I care about you.  You bring him back in one piece, or you can forget being Best Man.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Deb... It's me. I need you to step out front.
What?: Out front? You home, baby? I got a surprise for you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ben?
What?: Don't come any closer for a sec. This is gonna be kind of a shock... You remember when we said "together forever no matter what"?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh my G-g-g. What did you... do to Ben?
What?: Deb, it's me. It's still me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What did you wish for, honey?
What?: I already got it. Everything I want.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Good thing it ain't workin... Reed, what are we doing here? This guy's fast-food, strip-mall science --
What?: This wasn't our first stop, in case you forgot NASA. And Victor's not that bad. He's just a little...  Larger than life.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He's financed some of the biggest breakthroughs of this century.
What?: You'd never know it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I can't take this.
What?: Ben. This is business. Just work.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What about his first born?
What?: Ben, the money's not important. We could save lives.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He knew about NASA. What if he made the call to shut us down --
What?: Ben, think about all the people we can help if this works --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Maybe you should think about yourself for once. You always let this guy push you round --
What?: We got what we wanted. That's enough.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Can't do it. I cannot do it.
What?: External SRBs, orbital system engines. Its just like the shuttles you flew in --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No. I cannot take orders from that underwear model. That wingnut washed out of NASA for sneaking two Victoria Secret wannabes into a flight simulator.
What?: Youthful high spirits.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They crashed it into a wall. A flight simulator.
What?: I'm sure he's matured since then.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: When have I asked you to do something you absolutely said you could not do?
What?: Five times.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I had it at four.
What?: This makes five.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Isn't that your speech?
What?: He's made a few changes.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: This is your dream, Reed. You should be the one up there.
What?: Victor's better at these things.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The shields on the station should protect us.
What?: Should?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I ain't done arranging your flowers, egghead.
What?: Ben. This is serious. Turn around.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How long was I out?
What?: Three days. I was worried about you. How are you feeling?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I don't know. I just keep going over and over the numbers.
What?: Reed. Even you can't compute every little thing.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You go through something like this, makes you appreciate having the right woman in your life.
What?: Yeah, you and Debbie and perfect --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What? Come on. She's got a good thing with Victor --
What?: I'm sorry, did that cosmic-bath loosen your screws?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He's smart, powerful, successful --
What?: Well maybe you should date him.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Are you alright?
What?: I think I need to lie down. Bad shrimp.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What the --!
What?: Ben. Are you okay?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We had a tough year.
What?: Yeah, nine years straight.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You got a chisel round here?
What?: If we're going to identify the source of the mutation, we need to isolate your recombinant DNA so we can activate positional genomes.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Okay. I've uh, got some questions, from Sue. That she thought might be better coming from me... Can you, you know, go to the bathroom... like normal...
What?: Yeah.  You don't wanna know the details.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ben, I'm afraid I've got to ask --
What?: Not unless you want that clipboard stretched up your --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's about to be a broken face.
What?: This isn't permanent, Johnny. We need to be careful until we're normal again.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ben --
What?: Oh, you remember my name do you? You happen to remember what you swore to do with every breath in your body?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We're working as hard as we can --
What?: Yeah. I can tell. Victor was right.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Glad "nothing" could take you away from your work.
What?: Ben, I don't know if this thing'll change us back or make us worse. I need you to be patient for a little while longe--

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Time for your lesson, Vic. Chem 101: what happens when you supercool hot metal...?  Ben...
What?: Got it, teach.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ben, I've been crunching the numbers on the machine. I think if we can rework the power settings...
What?: Forget it, egghead. I'm good as is.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What the hell you smiling at? Just keep your mouth shut, and your mind on those SMBs --
What?: Actually, the engines are SMEs. Hydrogenbase, carbon propellant. Couple generations past your last ride.  I'm not as dumb as you look.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: If you behave, maybe next time daddy'll let you drive.
What?: Keep talking, there won't be a next time.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Please tell me your dawg's not trying to rekindle things with my sister.
What?: 'Course not. Strictly business.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yeah, well, his eyes say different.
What?: Hey, two hearts got busted last time. Maybe she's not over it either.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Let's see: you got Victor, stud of the year, more coin than God? Or Reed, the world's dumbest smart guy worth less than a postage stamp. Hmmm, it's a toss-up.
What?: Put your tiny little mind at ease.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Where... where am I?
What?: Back on Earth. Victor's medical facility... We're in quarantine.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Reed?... Sue?
What?: They're fine. Everybody else... is fine.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What's wrong with me?
What?: I swear to you they've done everything humanly possible. The best plastic surgeons in the world, Ben. You had the best --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They said that's not such a good idea, the shock alone could --
What?: Give me the god damn mirror!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Hey! That's a prototype!
What?: Go back to the drawing board.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The machine works. And Vic's gone Mister Hyde on us --
What?: Really? With a name like Von Doom? Never saw that one coming.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No more cracks about how I look.
What?: Hey, I'm Mr. Sensitivity now.  Clear the way, wide load coming through.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Your tissue, your organs, your entire biophysical structure is changing. Every system is still functioning, somehow --
What?: And they're changing into...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I don't really know. A compound organic-metallic alloy. Stronger than titanium or carbon steel. Harder than diamonds --
What?: Like the shields Reed said would protect us.  How long?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: At this rate, the infection should be complete in two, maybe three weeks --
What?: What do you mean "complete"?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What?
What?: The Center for Disease Control. If this thing is contagious --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But... this disease... is progressive... degenerative...
What?: That's terrible news...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And where do we think we're going?
What?: I don't know if "we've" noticed, but the sickest runs this side of the Alps are right outside that window --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're hot!
What?: So are you!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I mean, you feel a little feverish.
What?: I've never felt better in my life. When do you get off work?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: My shift ends at four, but I couldn't --
What?: Meet me at 4:01, top of the run. That'll give you a minute to freshen up.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Me like-y.
What?: Stay right. Left is trouble.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I though we went over this.
What?: Last one down springs for room service.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're on fire!
What?: Not this again --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Victor's right. Johnny, get to the command center. Close the shields.
What?: What about you?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He's not responsive --
What?: Ben! Ben!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Now what is up with that?
What?: The cloud has fundamentally altered our DNA.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh, you dawg you. Better not be my nurse!
What?: Ben, are you there?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: This is wrong in so many ways.
What?: You've been working out.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ben Grimm is a genuine American hero who's been through a terrible orde--
What?: What he's trying to say is: every team needs a mascot...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Twenty? From outside the place looks a lot taller.
What?: Oh, it is.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We should stay here until we can define the extent of our changes...
What?: This place is deluxe. You got cable?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Back it down, Johnny!
What?: I can go hotter!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Not only could you kill yourself, but you could set fire to Earth's atmosphere and destroy all human life as we know it.
What?: Gotcha. Okay. Supernova bad.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Is there something about flames? About flaming, that you --
What?: What are you trying to say? Just because I dress well and like to dance --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What? No. I'm trying to figure out why we each ended up with different symptoms.
What?: Oh, well that's easy: I'm hot. You're... well, you're a little limp. Sue's easy to see through. And Ben's always been a hardass.  Why aren't you writing this down?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He's right. These costumes are... missing something. I can't put my finger on it --
What?: They're not costumes.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: That's what I'm trying to calculate. And it's not rubber. It's muscle, tendon. I seem to have the ability to manipulate the malleability of my molecular structure and redistribute my density to --
What?: Right, whatever, have fun.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You need to control yourself and think before you --
What?: Act. Here we go again. Reed, what if we got these gifts for a reason? What if we have some, you know... like, calling?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Johnny. SUPERNOVA.
What?: But all these people...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The synthetics act as a second skin, adapting to your individual needs to --
What?: Keep the hot side hot, and the cool side cool!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Apparently I can disappear.
What?: Please tell me you go silent too.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Flame on, flame off. Flame on, flame off --
What?: Johnny.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Stop it.
What?: Okay, "mom."

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What is that thing?
What?: I think that thing is Ben.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Wait. You mean there's chance we could be full-on-24-7-fantastic?
What?: Grow up, Johnny. You want to run around on fire for the rest of your life?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're really cramping my style here.
What?: You were at 4000 Kelvin. Any hotter, you're approaching supernova --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sweet.
What?: That's the temperature of the sun.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Uh, we call my sister the invisible girl... the Invisible Girl.
What?: Girl...?!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm driving.
What?: Dude. That's my sister.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're gonna pay for that, Pebbles.  What?!
What?: You gave us names? What are you, the "face" of the Fantastic Four now?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You two need a time-out.
What?: Blockhead started it!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Johnny? Did you see Ben?
What?: Yeah, for the last time, I hope. I'm done with this freak show. I'm moving back to the real world.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Is that what you call it? "Real"?
What?: At least it beats living in a lab like somebody's science project.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Johnny, slow down. Think. You know mom didn't raise us to --
What?: Look around, sis! She's not here. So you can stop talking to me like I'm your little boy --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm sorry, sis, for leaving you guys --
What?: No, I'm sorry, for pushing you out.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What are you doing --
What?: Sis. Let me take care of you for once.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: If Reed's right, then this little trip will double our stock offering.
What?: And if he's not...?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They're ready for you, sir.
What?: Showtime.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Our numbers are through the roof. The IPO's tracking at fifty, sixty a share. The bank's five times oversubscribed --
What?: It's not just the money. I could make money in my sleep.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Then what is it?
What?: History, Leonard. History. Everything else is conversation...  How's the other matter?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Leonard, how's the feed?
What?: Recording, sir. We see you perfectly.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How's the IPO?
What?: Stable. We're looking at low twenties. It's a good number, considering the fallout from --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Reed's disaster. You know, I half- think he did this to me on purpose.
What?: Sir, I'm sure he wouldn't put himself --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Get me on the AM shows, Larry King, cover of the Journal...  I've got to do something about this scar. Make sure they only shoot my right side.
What?: Actually, uh, people seem to think the scar "humanizes" you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You know, maybe you should get some rest --
What?: Later. First, I've got some unfinished business. A deal that needs closing...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sir, I've always wondered... Why Sue? You could have any woman in the world but --
What?: That's why. Because I could have any other woman... You know, when they asked Caesar "why England," he said, "because it's not mine."

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Make sure you find Ben, bring him back here. And keep it quiet. I don't need this to hit the press.
What?: Yes sir. You've got the Mayor at eight, then a nine-thirty interview with the Journal --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Front page?
What?: Top left, like you asked.  Today Wall Street. Tomorrow, who knows... maybe Washington.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're, you've, I mean, how have you bee--
What?: Never better.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Those solar winds are flaring, but I factored them into my coordinates and --
What?: I was talking about us. Working together.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well, uh, based on our history... you can handle the biogenetics, and I'll focus on the molecular physics. Or, uhm, maybe I should take the biotech, you work the microscopes, since you have some background in electropho--
What?: Right. That's exactly what I meant.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I, uh, think I remember the number.
What?: It's been changed.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: As far as crew, I was hoping Ben could pilot the mission --
What?: Well, he's welcome to ride shotgun, but we already have a pilot on our payroll. You remember my brother Johnny...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Material made from self-regulating unstable molecules. I've been working on a formula for this.
What?: Great minds think alike.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Feeling better?
What?: Yes, thanks.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: That's good. That's uh... good.
What?: You always had a way with words.  I should be getting back.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're happy for me and Victor.
What?: I can tell you guys are enjoying what was the best part of our relationship --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Which was?
What?: Passion.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: For science.
What?: You are such a dork, Reed... You never got it and never will unless it's explained to you in quantum physics.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Uh, Sue...? I can't.
What?: What? What do you mean you --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It has to be the cloud. It's fundamentally altered our DNA.
What?: Let's not jump to conclusions, we need a massive amount of evidence before making that leap.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What?
What?: We need to get past them.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sue. Your clothes. Lose them.
What?: What...?  Oh.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How come Ben can't turn it on and off like us?
What?: That's what we're here to find out.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's not "invisibility" per se. You're bending the light around you with some kind of malleable force field. That's what you projected on the Bridge.
What?: What about you? You haven't eaten in days. How come you're never on this side of the microscope?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You should be able to bend light around other objects, even people, if you could control your emotional state better --
What?: Excuse me?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm saying, if you had a little more self control, you could locate the trigger. Can you remember the exact emotions when --
What?: Anger. Rage. Frustration.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Okay. Is there any way to duplicate that feeling? Some memory or...
What?: I'm sure I can come up with something.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to do that... You must think that was some kind of latent hostility or --
What?: What in the world would give me that idea?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I mean, you broke up with me, right?
What?: Are you kidding?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Reed. I was ready for the next step, you weren't, ergo, I walked.
What?: I think it was a little more complicated than --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: There were a lot of variables to consider --
What?: No. There weren't. There was you. And me. No variables, no math. It was actually the simplest thing in the world. But your head got in the way... like it always does.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What are you doing?
What?: The plants, from space. Their particles are still charged. With the right amount of energy, those ions could create the elemental profile of the cosmic storm.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: If we can build a machine to re-create the storm, we can reverse the polarity --
What?: And reverse the mutations --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But we're the focus, right Reed? Reed...?
What?: Of course. Of course.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And you sure you can control this thing? Last time didn't work out so well.
What?: With the right energy, we can stabilize the storm. Maybe tie into the city grid...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Reed. How close are we to a cure?
What?: No way to know. Without more tests, experiments.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Don't let Victor push you into making a mistake --
What?: He was going to take away all my data, equipment --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Which is why I'm working twenty hours a day, checking every variable --
What?: Every variable but yourself. You don't eat, sleep. You can't live in your head like --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I could get Ben to tap into the Baxter's main power to generate enough voltage --
What?: Reed. Shh. Just be quiet. And look up.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Remember our first date here...? God, I was so nervous.
What?: You were?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You know, I bribed the projectionist ten bucks to keep it open late?
What?: I gave him twenty.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You always talked about how you liked the kind of man who could approach you... speak his mind. One who wasn't afraid to tell you what he wanted.
What?: I did. I did, Reed... but I wanted you to be that man.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: When I walked out, I waited ten minutes outside your door. Ten. Waiting for you to come find me.
What?: Why didn't you say something?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I can... make it work.
What?: Reed, stop, you need to rest your --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The power... I need... more power... to control... the storm --
What?: You need a doctor.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sue, I need some of that anger, rage, frustration --
What?: I'm sure I can come up with something.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I found a broken gasket, from space --
What?: A gasket? Reed, we're at a party.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But dreams don't pay the bills, do they?  Same old Reed, the hopeless optimist. Still reaching for the stars, with the world on your back.
What?: You remember in school we talked about working together. That's what I was about to explain...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: This isn't going to be a problem, is it?
What?: Not at all.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You back this mission, and I'll sign over a fair percentage of any applications or --
What?: The number's seventy-five. And it's applications and patents.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Funny how things turn out, isn't it?
What?: Hilarious.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Got it. So take a walk, Ben... I'm going to borrow Susan for a second.
What?: Sure.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We've got minutes until it hits, not hours... Victor, that storm's deadly -- the radiation's lethal. We need to abort.
What?: Get a grip. Reed. We didn't come all this way to lose our nerve at the first little glitch. Just close the shields...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ben's still out there --
What?: So reel him in. But we came here to do a job. So let's do it. Quickly.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Come on, Ben, come on...
What?: Reed, we're running out of time.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Not until Ben is back inside!
What?: It's too late for him, and soon it'll be too late for all of us.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Just a little banged up. A couple scrapes. Why?
What?: Ben did this.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ben did this?
What?: He's had some kind of... reaction to exposure from the cloud. And he's not the only one.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm starting to wonder the same thing... How much do you know about what happened to you?
What?: Not much. We need to run tests to see the extent of the damage.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Didn't go as planned? It was a catastrophe. You ruined the lives of four people --
What?: I ruined? With all due respect, I told you to abort --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Abort? Reed, I put my company, my name, billions of dollars on the line, and I will not let you make me look like a fool --
What?: Victor, if we could understand what happened to us --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What are you doing here?
What?: What I should have done a long time ago. Applications and patents, Reed. This all belongs to me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But I'm not done with the machine --
What?: Which is precisely the point. Analysis is over. It's time for action. My men could have mass-produced this by now.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's just business.
What?: I think you both know my Director of Genetic Research, Susan Storm.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Surprised I agreed to Reed's proposal?
What?: I understand the business reasons.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's been a good two years, Victor... The company's accomplished so much.
What?: Right, of course, the company... But you see, I've come to realize all the accomplishments in the world mean nothing without someone to share them with --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Uh, Victor, I hope I haven't done something to make you think...
What?: Sue, I've lived my life unafraid of taking big steps. And this is the biggest step yet. If it helps, think of this as a promotion. A merger of sorts...  Four little words that can change our lives...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What are you doing?
What?: Raising the shields.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What's going on?
What?: Victor, are you feeling alright?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Victor, I'm sorry I --
What?: Just find him.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Victor, your scar --
What?: I told you, I'm fine. It's you I'm worried about.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm sorry I didn't get a chance to --
What?: Please, no apologies. I've arranged for your things to be moved to one of my condos. You'll have round-the clock care.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You said it was urgent.
What?: It is. There's something we need to talk about. Something I need to ask you...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Victor, wait, slow down a second. I want you to know I appreciate everything you've done for me, but I just don't --
What?: Susan. What are you doing?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He's working round the clock. But the data needs to be tested, analyzed before --
What?: Same old Reed. All analysis, no action. Wasn't that the problem with you two?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: If these molecules aren't stable, they could make us worse, maybe even kill us.
What?: Then why is Reed dragging his feet? Maybe he likes having his prize specimen under glass...  It's ironic, isn't it? You're finally the perfect woman for him... because you're his science project.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Please don't make this personal --
What?: Oh, I think you already have.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: 'Scuse me.
What?: I know it can't be easy. Life hasn't changed that much for Reed, Sue and Johnny. At least they can go out in public. But for you? People staring. Whispering behind your back...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: If you're trying to cheer me up you're doing a helluva job --
What?: I'm just saying, I know what it's like to lose something you love. To see it slip away, and know it's never coming back.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Reed's gonna fix me up --
What?: For your sake I hope you're right. I'm sorry if that sounds a little skeptical.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sir?  This telegram came for you. Actually, it isn't for you. It's for somebody named Thompson, but it says 'care of Raoul Duke'. Does that make sense?
What?: Yes... It makes sense.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I checked the register for this man Thompson. We don't show him but I figured he might be part of your team.
What?: He is. Don't worry, I'll get it to him.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What confused us was Dr. Gonzo's signature on the telegram from Los Angeles. When we knew he was right here in the hotel.
What?: You did the right thing. Never try to understand a press message. About half the time we use codes -- especially with Dr. Gonzo.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Tell me. When will the doctor be awake?
What?: Awake? What do you mean?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well... the manager, Mr. Heem, would like to meet him. Nothing unusual. Mr. Heem likes to meet all our large accounts... put them on a personal basis... just a chat and a handshake, you understand.
What?: Of course. But if I were you, I'd leave the Doctor alone until after he's eaten breakfast. He's a very crude man.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But he will be available? Perhaps later this morning?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Certainly, Mr. Duke!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What? Ah... yes, yes, I see what you mean... Yes... so, you'll be responsible then?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Rum and ice, please.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Naked!?
What?: Naked.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Cut their goddamn heads off. Every one of them. That's what we're doing in California.
What?: WHAT?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Hell, no. We'd never hear the goddamn end of it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Naw!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What happened? What did they do to her?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yeh. The big guy used to be a major in the Marines.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We know where he lives, but we can't get near the house.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He wanted the pineal gland.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Hell, I really hate to hear this. Because everything that happens in California seems to get down our way, sooner or later. Mostly Atlanta. What?: You're going to need to take the bull by the horns -- go to the mat with this scum.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What do you mean by that?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Where ya comin' from, young man?
What?: Las Vegas.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: A great town, that Vegas. I bet you had good luck there. You're the type.
What?: I know. I'm a triple Scorpio.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh, my God!...
What?: This is my granddaughter...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I want you to understand that this man at the wheel is my attorney! He's not just some dingbat I found on the Strip. He's a foreigner. I think he's probably Samoan. But it doesn't matter, does it? Are you prejudiced?
What?: Hell, no!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I didn't think so. Because in spite of his race, this man is extremely valuable to me. Hell, I forgot all about this beer. You want one?  How about some ether?
What?: What?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: "One toke over the line, sweet Jesus."

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We're your friends. We're not like the others.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Or just think it? Was I talking? Did they hear me?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: God hell! I think I see the pattern! This one sounds like real trouble! You're going to need plenty of legal advice before this thing is over. What?: Why not? If a thing's worth doing, it's worth doing right.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We won't make the nut unless we have unlimited credit.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: ...and we're chock full of that!
What?: Damn right!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He said he understood, but I could see in his eyes that he didn't. He was lying to me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Where's the medicine?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Turn up the fucking music! My heart feels like an alligator! Volume! Clarity! Bass! We must have bass! What's wrong with us? Are you goddamn old ladies?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What the fuck are we doing out here? Somebody call the police! We need help!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Savage Henry has cashed his check! We're going to rip his lungs out!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh, Jesus! Did you see what god just did to us?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You better be careful. Plenty of vultures out here. They'll pick your bones clean before morning.
What?: You whore!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How long do I have?

Checking into a Vegas hotel under a phony name with intent to commit capital fraud and a head full of acid.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Two Cuba Libres with beer and mescal on the side.  Who's Lacerda, he's waiting for us in a room on the twelfth floor?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I was right in the middle of a fucking reptile zoo. And somebody was giving booze to these goddamn things! It won't be long before they tear us to shreds!
What?: If you think we're in trouble now wait until you see what's happening in the elevators.

What?: But what about our room? And the golf shoes?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: That's the press table. Where you have to sign in for our credentials. Shit, let's get it over with. You handle that, and I'll check on the room.
What?: No, no. Don't leave me!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Shoot it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What are you talking about?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: That's good...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why?
What?: Why what?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Holy shit! They almost had us there! That was quick thinking.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jesus creeping shit!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: This is the place. They'll never fuck with us here.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Some angry Rotarian shoves you and you think: What's happening here? What's going on? Then you hear yourself mumbling.
What?: Dogs fucked the Pope, no fault of mine. Watch out!... Why money? My name is Brinks

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I want to leave fast.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yeah... I thought we might need it...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Don't kid yourself. That Portuguese son of a bitch is dangerous. He's watching us like a hawk.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You evil son of a bitch. You better hope there's some Thorazine in that bag, because if there's not, you're in bad trouble.

What?: Jefferson Airplane. "White Rabbit." I want a rising sound.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jesus.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You cheap honky sonofabitch...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The cops?
What?: There's no choice. I wouldn't dare go to sleep with you wandering around with a head full of acid and wanting to slice me up with that goddamn knife!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You bastard! I need a lawyer immediately!
What?: What are you doing in Baker? Didn't you get my telegram?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You degenerate pig!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: WELL? What are your plans?
What?: Plans?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Lucy.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jesus Christ. I knew you were sick but I never expected to hear you actually say that kind of stuff.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: NO! Stop talking like that.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You filthy bastard. I should cave your fucking head in.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: NO! I felt sorry for the girl, I wanted to help her!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What?... What kind of goddamn monster are you?
What?: It just occurred to me, that she has no witnesses. Anything that she says about us is completely worthless.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Okay, Lucy, it's time to go meet Barbra...
What?: I felt like a Nazi, but it had to be done.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I gave the cabbie an extra ten bucks to make sure she gets there safe. Also, I told him I'd be there myself in an hour, and if she wasn't, I'd come back out here and rip his lungs out.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: As your attorney, I advise you to tell me where you put the goddamn mescaline.
What?: Maybe we should take it easy tonight.

What?: They're actually nice people when you get to know them.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Man, I know these people in my goddamn blood!
What?: Don't mention that word around here. You'll get them excited.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: This is a fucking nightmare.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Read the newspapers.
What?: Man, you don't know trouble until you have to face down a bunch of these addicts gone crazy for human sacrifice!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Like big lizards.
What?: ...and every one of them stacked naked...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yeh, naked!... except for the weapons.
What?: They were all veterans.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What's wrong with you? Hell, somebody has to do it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sure. It's all on the Q.T., but everybody who matters is with us all the way down the line.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sometimes it's easier to just rip out the backstraps.
What?: They'll fight like hell if you try to take the head without the dogs.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Good work.  They'll treat us like goddamn lepers after that.
What?: Lucy is looking for you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No, she's looking for you.
What?: Me?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: OK, goddamnit!... Look... I'll call her. I'll get her off our backs. You're right. She's my problem.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What is this?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Adrenochrome...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Never mind, it's absolutely pure.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I know, but the guy didn't have any cash to pay me. He's one of these Satanism freaks. What?: I could already feel the stuff working on me -- the first wave felt like a combination of mescaline and methedrine -- maybe I should take a swim, I thought...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why not? We should get some of that. Just eat a big handful and see what happens.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Extract of pineal!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Man, your head would swell up like a watermelon, you'd probably gain about a hundred pounds in two hours...
What?: Right!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: ...grow claws... bleeding warts.
What?: Yes!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Man I'll try about anything

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: So do we, lady.
What?: I think we should put her on the payroll. See what she comes up with.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Alright, Alice... you'll be contacted by Inspector Rock. Arthur Rock. He'll be posing as a politician.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Fuck the car. They should make these things with a goddamn FM radio.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: There was nothing in the atmosphere of the North Star to put me on my guard...
What?: Two glasses of ice water with ice.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I was stupid with shock -- not knowing whether to run or start laughing.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What are you doing? You were supposed to turn back there!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The airport is over there!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No! I can't get out! They'll crucify me. I'll have to take the blame!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Please... please... I'm only the maid. I didn't mean nothin!...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You'd pay me for that?

The only constant you will know will be the others and the tradition their greed and quest represent.  But life without morality, without the ability to truly taste the sweetness of wine and love, is no life at all.  That is how the others exist.  Nothing more than walking corpses living only to slaughter each other in an insane quest to be the last.  Keep your soul sewed to the earth.  Do not become one of them.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well, it's sandstone. Christian symbol. Early Latin text. Mid-Twelfth Century, I should think.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The Arthur Legend. I've heard this bedtime story before.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: An old man's dream.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Let me tell you another "bedtime story," Doctor Jones. After the Grail was entrusted to Joseph of Arimathaea, it disappeared and was lost for a thousand years before it was found again by three Knights of the First Crusade. Three brothers, to be exact.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: This is the manuscript in which the friar chronicled the Knight's story... it doesn't reveal on location of the Grail, I'm afraid... but the Knight promised that two "markers" that had been left behind would. Our project leader believes that tomb to be located within the city of Venice, Italy.  As you can now see, Doctor Jones, we're about to complete a great quest that began almost two thousand years ago. We're only one step away.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You could be more right than you know.

What?: The deeper she goes, the harder it is to contact her. Once she is below the second level, you will not be able to reach her at all.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I cannot reach her.
What?: She is too deep. The curved tunnel we saw is part of the Vortex, the place of The Beast.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The first time, when they attacked long ago, was The Beast here?
What?: No. Then they were led by his underlings. But I knew he had come this time, from the ferocity of their onslaught, from their use of The Fortress. They use up much of their strength to do these things. They are taking great risks.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: <u>Why</u>?
What?: I'm not sure.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But you suspect.
What?: You will know, in good time.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No. We will find another way to locate the Fortress.
What?: There is no other way. You asked me why the Beast had come this time.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes.
What?: He has come for Lyssa.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Lyssa? <u>Why</u>?
What?: Like you, she has extraordinary powers. He would make her his Queen.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Can she be forced?
What?: No. She must agree of her own free will.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Never.
What?: You are young. You don't understand the attraction of great power, and you forget the pain of long waiting.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Then we must reach her before she feels that pain.
What?: Yes.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Traitor! She'll marry you in hell!
What?: He thinks you betray him with Lyssa.  Colwyn! The waters deceive you!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I will melt that gold and pour it down your throat, old man!
What?: He sees betrayal everywhere. He will attack us so long as he is conscious.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: From here, I must go alone.
What?: You will tell me her name and we will go together.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He ran a great risk, helping us today. If he opposes his fate, his death will be terribly painful.
What?: Let us wish him peace.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They will hold Lyssa in the Center of the Vortex, the place of the Beast, where its power is greatest. No man can match it there. Lyssa must try to move toward us. For as we enter the Vortex and move closer ...
What?: The Beast will kill her.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: She must make a glaive.
What?: Lyssa, your bracelets. Bend them straight and cross them.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The spiral begins in the west.
What?: Where the spiral begins.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: She's on the other side of this wall. I can feel it!
What?: I chose the wrong passage.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: She can see the Beast!
What?: Use your sword.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What use is my sword? I can't reach her!
What?: Cut. <u>Cut</u>!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You must move quickly. The Beast will stop at nothing now.
What?: You're coming with us.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It is my fate to die in the Fortress.
What?: No! You cannot know that!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I can. Because I choose it.
What?: I forbid you!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How did you know?
What?: I found the body of the Seer in the stream.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Slayers!
What?: We must enter the swamp.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Do not let the waters touch you.
What?: What will happen?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They can be saddled.
What?: You have done it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I road them often in my youth.
What?: Saddles.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It is today?
What?: Yes. It is today.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Each to his fate.
What?: Each to his fate.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I know the cruelty of such a fate.
What?: Perhaps you think no man would return to me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Am I not worth returning to?
What?: Yes.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Am I not beautiful enough to be loved?
What?: Yes.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Even by you?
What?: Yes.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You too are lonely.
What?: I ache with it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Let me comfort you.
What?: I cannot take comfort when she has none.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Then give me comfort. Sleep with me tonight.
What?: I cannot betray my bride.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I feel your pain, but I cannot betray her.
What?: You will not, then?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Help! Help! I'm drowning!
What?: I doubt it. The water is only an inch deep.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It could have been quicksand! I might have been sucked to my death.  Where is this place?
What?: A forest near the Valley of Needles.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Blast! A thousand miles off course. Well, I was rushed. There was a certain difference of opinion concerning a venison pie. The foolish man left it sitting on his windowsill. What did he expect?
What?: Perhaps he expected to eat it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I just remembered I have urgent business in this direction.
What?: What business?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Once is enough, thank you.
What?: He saved our lives.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Your kingship ... your lord high mightiness ... when I called you a ... a ... whatever I called you, I didn't realize that you were ... were ...
What?: I was hoping I might be your friend.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: My <u>friend</u>.
What?: I have need of friends.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Not yet, my friend. It's your tomato that's dying.
What?: <u>What</u>? Oh no! Better it was me. There isn't another good tomato within a hundred leagues.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Try your tricks on me and I'll turn myself back into a snake and bite you.
What?: You and I will guard the fire.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I don't think you'll grow careless.
What?: Smart as well as quick. Now what do you have to give us?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Fame.
What?: Fame?  Thank you, no. Fame is the burial ground of contentment. Eat it and go hungry

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Fame is what you leave to your sons.
What?: How did you know I had sons?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Because you would not rob if you had no children to provide for.
What?: Hah! You don't know me, boy.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They stand at the edge of the grave and make jokes.  Do you know who I am, sprout? I am Torquil, Lord of the forest. My men follow no man but me, and I follow no man at all.
What?: You will follow me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And in the few seconds before I dice you to crow-food, tell me why I am going to follow you.
What?: So your sons will speak of you to your grandsons, and your grandsons to their grandsons.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And where do you lead, boy?
What?: To the place where Death lives.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It should be an interesting journey, then.
What?: That I promise you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: When did you last sleep, boy?
What?: I'm all right.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They burn many villages. Even walled cities fall to them.
What?: Why do they burn the villages? There's nothing to gain.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm not hungry.
What?: Not sleepy, either?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Forgive me. It's childish to cry.
What?: Those are not child's tear. A child cries for himself, a man cries for those he loves.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well, I'm not impressed.
What?: I knew you would not be. That's why I chose you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You've eaten nothing.
What?: We must try to get horses.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes. It will double our range.  I know at least a dozen ways to get horses. All cheap.
What?: These we'll pay for.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Lad, you have an unnatural desire to pay for things. It stunts the mind and shrivels the imagination.
What?: Hand over your dinner.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Forgive me, my friends. I saw terrible things.
What?: They do not exist, except in the waters of the Swamp, where they will remain.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Go, join them.
What?: What kind of friend do you think I am?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The best. But my unhappiness is not made lighter by adding your's to it.
What?: Well, it is true that if I received a royal command I couldn't very well disobey it, could I?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Go. I command you.
What?: Yes, my lord.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We could reach it on fire-mares.
What?: Those beasts cannot be saddled by mortal men.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We must cover a hundred leagues before sunrise.
What?: At the gallop!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're resourceful, my lad.  I tell you, one year under my tutelage and I could make you the Prince of Thieves.
What?: Subject to the King, no doubt.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: A good thrust, my friend. Another second and there'd have been nothing between my head and shoulders but bad memories.
What?: I intend to keep you alive, your majesty. So you can abdicate your throne and become my Warlord.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Make for the wall. I'll catch up.
What?: Colwyn, don't be a fool. You can't do battle with that thing.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Nothing worse than lower-class boors with upper-class morals.
What?: Would you settle for a boar?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You!
What?: Me.  May I eat with you tonight?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Tonight and every night, my friend, for this is the second time you've saved my life.  I am Ergo the Magnificent, short in stature, tall in power, etcetera, etcetera.
What?: I am Quell.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What is that awful looking place?
What?: The Swamp of Betrayal. Be glad we don't have to cross it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Where are you going?
What?: We'll meet you at the inn.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Can't I come, too?
What?: No.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: A venison pie as big as a house.
What?: A small house.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Quell?
What?: I cannot go with you, my friend.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: My heart stays here.
What?: And mine goes with you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Bread is for peasants, and wine makes me sneeze. Got any gumdrops?
What?: No.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sugarballs?
What?: No.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What kind of a boy are you? Boys always have candy.
What?: I have a cinnamon bar.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You do?
What?: You can have half.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I am Ergo the Magnificent ...  ... short in stature ...  ... tall in power ...  ... narrow of purpose ...  ... wide of vision.
What?: I ...  ... am Titch.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm hungry.
What?: Smart lad.  Bring me my spices!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: If I could wish ...  ... for anything, I'd wish for a venison pie the size of a ...  ... mountain. No, that's too greedy. I'd settle for one the size of a house.
What?: I'd wish for a puppy.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: One puppy? Why not wish for a hundred?
What?: I only want one.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sir Ergo? ... My honorable Lord Ergo? ...
What?: First, you desert me, and now you mock me. Go back to your one-eyed friend.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What? Now you poke me in the nose as well?
What?: I don't think it's working.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Not working? This nose? This nose works day and night. This nose has never loafed an hour in its life. This nose ...  What?  Impossible. This nose asleep while venison fills the air?  Where is it, boy? Tell me where it is and I forgive you everything.
What?: It's right behind you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We meant only to please you.
What?: And do you think I'm not going to eat myself to death this very night? Huh?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh, she was so beautiful - and I was so <u>ugly</u>.
What?: Would you desert your friends?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But also very young. Six to one is no odds, boy.
What?: Get me down from here you louts or I'll turn you all into pigs!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Put me down, you lout!
What?: You had better manners as a pig.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What are you doing with my dear? Stop! Thieves!
What?: Many villagers are hiding in the forest. They need food.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And do you think I live on air?
What?: We have plenty of hares.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Food for crows.
What?: Surely a sorcerer of the sauce pan can make rabbit taste like venison.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I am being exploited! Where are you going?
What?: I must take the old man to see some sick children. Kegan will guard you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh, my poor stew!
What?: Oh, my poor stomach.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Passable, pimple, very passable.
What?: The greatest boon of your otherwise worthless life, blockhead, is the privilege of dining on boar roasted by the hand of Ergo the Magnificent.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I can't hold the weight of both of you!
What?: Hush!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Look at its beauty. Look at its grace.
What?: Look at its insides.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: My spells always go wrong when I am observed. Be gone!
What?: The forest is not safe these days. You'd best travel with us.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: One with red eyes, the other with one eye, both trying to kill me.
What?: The one with red eyes was a Dark One, the other was a Cyclops, and it was not you he meant to kill.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He was aiming a huge spear right at me!
What?: If that were so, you'd be dead now. He was aiming at the Dark One, for there is ancient hatred between them. Once his race had two eyes, like other men, until his forefathers bargained with the Dark Ones: they gave up one of their eyes in return for the power to see the future. But they were cheated, for the only future they were permitted to see was the time of their own death.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He didn't join them. They joined him.
What?: And who is <u>he</u> that they should join <u>him</u>?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He is the King.
What?: Well, at least I'm glad to see you have a sense of humor. That's the first smile I've seen on that gloomy face of your's ...  ... isn't it? It isn't. Oh no. Oh dear. Oh now I've gone and done it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They'll trample him to death!
What?: No. He will master the leader.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I do not want your power. It is hideous.
What?: You know nothing of power, you foolish girl. You think power is a mighty sword, or a strong castle, or the paltry magic of an Emerald Seer. Power is none of these.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I do not want your worlds or your slaves.
What?: Then look!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's a lie!
What?: These walls do not lie! He will betray you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He will not!
What?: Then he will die!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He will come for me.
What?: He will not come. You will be my queen.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What news from our friends?
What?: Barak is still strong in the north, and Tendo holds the high passes. But the great desert forts have fallen.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Freylag's stronghold?
What?: It has been taken, Freylag and all his people slaughtered.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It is only a few weeks and already half our strong places have fallen.
What?: The attacks are unceasing: by night, the Dark Ones

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It is the way of all invaders. Those they would conquer they divide, buying allies with promises of land and power.
What?: We will hold. Their power is not unlimited.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Lord Rowan is one of Lyssa's godfathers. He will defend her in the ceremony. I wish that Lord Modred were here. He is a godfather of her own blood.
What?: Modred has treated with the Dark Ones.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: For some, the lure of power is stronger than the ties of blood. No matter. I had hoped to have the wedding next spring, Lord Turold, with all the nobles of the kingdom in attendance. But Fate and this war have ordained otherwise.
What?: It is important to assure the succession.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I will tell you something you did not know, Turold. Had it been my choice, all those years ago, I would have chosen you for my king. But my parents chose otherwise.
What?: I knew.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You knew! You are a rude bumpkin!
What?: That I am, my lady.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: A girl of some spirit, your daughter.
What?: A match for your son, I think.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: A fine match.
What?: They will have the life that you and I might have had.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You were attacked in the forest?
What?: Yes. We lost five.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I tried to reach Ynyr, the old one. I led a hundred men to his place in Granite Needle, but it was surrounded. The Dark Ones guard it by night and by day they call out the Slayers. Ynyr cannot get out and no one can get in.
What?: How many did you lose?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sixty at the needle, another thirty in the forest. Only ten of us made it back.
What?: We will have to try again. His knowledge is great. Without it, we cannot hope to win.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Modred! Impossible!
What?: He leads a group of Slayers, under the leopard banner.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We seek the Fortress of Krull.
What?: Such a vision will be opposed. Who seeks it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The new King.
What?: With an old voice?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You know the voice.
What?: Yes. You have left your place in the Needle. It is the time, then.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It is the time.
What?: I will seek the Fortress for you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Can you see?
What?: Yes. It is the Western Ocean.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The Dark Ones will appose you with all their power.
What?: They will fail for, during the day, the power of the Circle is greater than theirs. Only at night can they pierce the Circle.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Knowledge I wouldn't want.
What?: No. They are sad, solitary creatures, rarely seen.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We'll seek an Emerald Seer. They have great powers of vision.
What?: There's an Emerald Circle a few leagues from here.  We'll find her.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We can save half a day by crossing the Stone Lake.
What?: Many have perished in that maze.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The leader of the Dark Ones?
What?: Yes.  Like you, a King. A King of many worlds. All enslaved.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I must go to the widow. Perhaps she will help.
What?: The Widow of the Web?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes.
What?: That creature helps no one. And none who go there return.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: She has the power of vision.
What?: She has the power to kill.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Perhaps she will not kill me, for I know her name.
What?: Her name is Death.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Few have survived it.
What?: Fewer will survive them.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Each to his fate, lad.
What?: Each to his fate. Wait for me at the inn. If I am not back by dawn, you will know my fate, and you must go on without me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We must reach the Valley of Reeds before the next dawn.
What?: It's a hundred leagues from here.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'll stay behind and keep them busy.
What?: It is not necessary. They will not follow.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Look.
What?: Yes, they are weakening. It takes great power to maintain the Fortress, and they have expended much.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Kegan!
What?: It is too late. He has drunk.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Go now.  Quell was wise. He knew that a man cannot ask more of his death than it help his friends.
What?: That is true.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Who speaks that name!
What?: Ynyr!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It is fifty years since I heard that name.
What?: It is fifty years since I spoke it to you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I was beautiful then.
What?: The most beautiful woman in the world.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But you would not stay with me.
What?: Could not. Could not betray the girl to whom I was betrothed.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: She was not as beautiful.
What?: No, she was not as beautiful.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: She bore you many children?
What?: We had no children.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You had a son.
What?: You said nothing. You told me nothing.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You had left me! I kept silent out of rage.
What?: Where is he? My son.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Do not try your trickery on me!
What?: It is no trickery.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You see?
What?: Yes.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Memory is no trick, it is a power. The power to see.
What?: Power you have given me. What can my power give you?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Knowledge.
What?: Of what?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The Fortress of Krull. When will it come near here?
What?: Why must you know?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: There is a girl there. Her name is Lyssa.
What?: You lie!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Could I lie to you and still see your beauty?
What?: No.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: A young man seeks her. A young man about the age I was when I met you.
What?: Tomorrow, the Fortress of Krull will rise with the sun in the Valley of Reeds. But the knowledge is of no use to you. No man has ever escaped the Web. And soon the creature will come for you, even here.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It will not help.
What?: Then the other Lyssa will share your fate. She will grow old in the Fortress as you have grown old here.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I cannot stop the sand.
What?: You cannot stop time. Go now, before it runs out.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You will come with me.
What?: There is sand enough for only one life. Go now, save the other.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why so few?
What?: Faith.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Fool's magic.
What?: Precisely.  Faith has persuaded them a pygmie with a sling can kill an armed giant.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Fight's over before it's begun... soon the survivors will be in full retreat.
What?: Then we smash 'em?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You go?  Not watch fun?
What?: I have something far more pleasant awaiting me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We come watch... we come watch...
What?: Nay.  This is a private affair, no audience welcome... Better you watch the dismantling of our enemies... and, look you, see the moat is set aflame.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Fire moat... why do that?
What?: Purely a precaution...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What?
What?: Delusion... a kind of magic which works against the magician.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Dumb magic.  Giant smash peewee.
What?: Always.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We go out, smash 'em now?
What?: No.  Smashing is not required.  I have a surprise for our tiny invaders... Raise that hatch!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Birdies... pretty...
What?: I doubt the faeries will admire their beauty... Come, this will be fun to watch.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We watch... good fun...
What?: Indeed, the best of fun... Enjoy yourselves.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: More fun win battle?
What?: This is another victory, my friends. What began with the lash shall be concluded with a caress.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You go to lady now?
What?: To finish last evening's delightful work.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: My generosity is not so large as that.
What?: What do you want with me?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Your love.
What?: Your words sting more sharply than your whip.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I speak of love, and you think only of the lash.
What?: You are cruel!  Your heartless jesting worse than torture!  How can you speak of love when you see what I am!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I like well what I see.  It pleases me.
What?: But I'm hideous!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're magnificent.
What?: Grotesque... monstrous...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: On the contrary!  The puling, pallid creature you were before was truly something disgusting.  Now you are splendid... a fierce goddess... the embodiment of all that is strong and beautiful.
What?: You lie!  You wish to humiliate me, as if the form I'm forced to bear were not punishment enough!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: God protect me.
What?: Not from me, surely...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You... you're a beast!
What?: We're all of us beasts, my dear. Only most are afraid to show it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And you... are you not also afraid?
What?: I am afraid of nothing.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Then why hide behind a mask?  You are ashamed!
What?: I know no more of shame than I do of fear.  I wear this mask not for concealment but protection.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Protection?
What?: I am a creature of darkness.  I require the shadow's solace and the black of night... Sunlight is abhorrent to me... I cover myself completely whenever I venture forth in daylight... Sunshine is my destroyer.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Like some vile toadstool.
What?: I prefer to think, more like the sagacious owl.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Do you feed on mice and rats?
What?: I prefer a plump capon, but will happily serve you rats if they're to your liking.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why have you brought me here?
What?: To be my bride, of course.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Damn you!
What?: We're both of us damned, my beauty.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: When the time's come, you won't need to jump, I'll throw you out myself!
What?: Do it now!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jack... Oh, Jack... Help me...
What?: Too bad your precious Jack can't hear you... the damsel in distress... A rescue attempt would be most amusing... We could flay sweet Jack alive as an after-dinner entertainment...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Your moans seem almost pleasurable, my dear... developing a taste for the lash?
What?: Kill me... I want... so nice...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No more... please...
What?: I can keep a victim alive for weeks... months, if I desire it... it's an art.  They beg for death... I keep it just out of their reach.  The pain remains constant.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sweet Princess, you begin to sound most reasonable.
What?: What do you want from me?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We'll get you cleaned up, find a suitable gown... I imagine you'll enjoy a good meal?
What?: Oh, yes...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: A few day's nourishment will see your strength returning.
What?: And then?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes?
What?: What will become of me then?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: When you are ripe for my pleasure, I will enjoy the harvest.
What?: I see...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm pleased you're not troubled by the prospect...
What?: Do as you wish with my body, you'll never possess my soul!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Your soul...?  Why should I bother with such a paltry trifle?
What?: I don't expect you'd understand.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're a beast!
What?: Indeed I am, my dear... that makes us a pair!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What was that?  Did you hear that?
What?: It's nothing.  My men take great delight in routing the enemy.  Don't trouble yourself, beauty.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It sounded like it came from the courtyard.
What?: From the parapets most likely.  The men are amused by a battlefield entertainment of my own contriving.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Might we watch, too?
What?: Later, beloved... Now I wish only to be with you...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And I with you... I never dreamed life held such pleasures...
What?: Pleasure is for those who seize it! Do you think those insipid, pale- skinned mortals will ever know such rapture?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's odd... when I first found myself... changing... I was sick with loathing and disgust.  I thought I was so ugly I wanted to die...
What?: And, now?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Now I want to live forever.  I've never felt so strong or happy.
What?: Or looked so beautiful...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes.  I feel that, too.  Weakness is what is ugly.
What?: Precisely, my darling.  Your animal strength, your primitive power has surfaced... you are what you desire.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: To be strong and free... that is all I desire.
What?: So you shall be... Like our brothers, the hawk and the wolf, our spirits know no master... we are created in the pure image of the savage God that set our turbulent universe in motion.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What you do, boy?  You be velly solly, come here intellupt my sleep.
What?: I didn't know... I --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What?  Speakee loud!  No hear velly good.
What?: I said, I mean no harm... I thought this as empty tomb.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You come stealee tleasoo?
What?: Oh, no, never... nothing like that... never crossed my mind.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No need lie, boy.  I no hurt you. Do I look like I wanna hurt you?
What?: Well, er... no.  I mean, you don't look like dragons I've heard of.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Course not.  I no flum here.  I come flum Cathay.
What?: Cathay?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Country fa' fa' away.  To the East, beyond the lising sun...
What?: East of Mercia?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You got no idee.  People there lookee diffelent
What?: You don't ravage the countryside, devouring maidens and burning the crops?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Dlagon not like that.  Dlagon is spilit of life... spilit of stlength and goodness.
What?: Then you'll understand my quest.  An ogre named Blackheart has killed the last stag unicorn and stolen his horn.  The world outside is cursed, plunged into eternal winter.  Unless I return the alicorn, the earth will be frozen forever.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Flozen foleva not good.
What?: It's terrible.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: An' how you do it?  How you rift cuss?
What?: I need your help.  In order to fight Blackheart, I must wear the armor of Achilles.  I --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You come stealee tleasoo?
What?: Oh no... Don't you understand?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No, wait... please... listen...
What?: No more listening!  Your time is at an end, insignificant whelp!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Friend Ogg.  Excuse our enthusiasm, occasioned as it was by a fondness for you.
What?: Honeythorn Gump, is it?  I've not seen your ugly face since you sold me a jug of cow piss claiming it was dragon's tears.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well, bygones're bygones, I always say.
What?: Or was it the time you and Jimmy Squarefoot stole the golden apples I'd forged.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Twas Jimmy done that, I merely stood for the blame unfairly... but, here now, Ogg, this be no time to rehash old differences, I've friends along in need of safe haven for the night.
What?: Who might these friends be?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Baron Couer de Noir is a blight 'gainst all nature.  We dwarves be not fighters
What?: We be honored, friend Ogg.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: So, Jack... think you be a Green Man and not know Gump.
What?: Gump, is it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Aye, Honeythorn Gump, come to serenade you, Jack... come to make you dance.
What?: I'm in no mood for dancing.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh, but you will be, Jack... Think you to sleep in a faerie ring and not spend the night a-dancing?
What?: Faerie ring?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No!  Tis not the time!  I want no part of your frolic.
What?: Dance, Jack!  The night's but begun.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Enough!
What?: And how is it a mortal dare dictate to the faerie folk?  Is me music not to your liking?  Mayhap the dance of death by more your pleasure.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No... I... I need to rest.
What?: You'll have a long, long rest in the tomb, me lad.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I meant no disrespect.
What?: Didn't you now?  Well then, answer me this riddle and all be forgiven.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And if I cannot?
What?: Why, Jack, then tis your death song I'll be strumming.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's bluebells!
What?: What!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Damnation!  Codfish and cockles! Gammon and trotters!  You've bested me, Jack.
What?: A riddle without an answer is but an empty cup when you're thirsty for wine.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You be our guest, Jack.
What?: I'm honored, Honeythorn Gump... but no more tricks.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You have me word, lad.  To answer a faerie riddle deserves as much.
What?: Twas the Princess Lili gave me the answer... have you seen her, by chance?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I've laid eyes on no mortal but you this day, Jack.
What?: I fear she's lost.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why, Jack-lad, she likes you, is all.  And what hot-blooded hero wouldn't welcome the affections of a fair nymph like Oona here...?  If your blood runs so cold, boy, you be a corpse before your time.
What?: What does she want from me?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Elderberry wine.  No finer drink under heaven.
What?: It looks... er, delicious...  Such a fine bouquet... very aromatic...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Are ye afraid of me wine?  Did your momma tell ye never to take food nor drink from the Wee Folk?  Think if ye sup with the faeries you'll be enchanted?
What?: Well... I... I don't want to be rude, but... it's generally known that --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Generally known!  What general ever knew more than to lace up his boots?
What?: Please don't misunderstand.  I am grateful for your hospitality and --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But... but, why?
What?: Big question that, lad.  Why what?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why has this happened to the world? Why is it winter now, and dark?
What?: Aye.  Honeythorn Gump'd be a powerful wizard indeed could he answer.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Don't you know?
What?: If you're looking for enchantment, Jack, that I can give thee...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: That much magic I can offer ye, a small measure of entertainment at best.  Making the world a frozen hell is beyond me modest powers.
What?: Then, what's gone wrong?  Why did it happen?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: If ye want more tricks, I'm your man, but for big questions ye must go elsewhere.
What?: Don't you care about what's happened?
