What?: And that's a good thing?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What are you doing?!
What?: Preventive medicine.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You can't do this, he's human, it's murder.
What?: It's war, now get the fuck out of the way!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Look, if what you say is true, if there's a chance I could turn into one of them, then I've got no choice, do I? I have to work with you. I need to learn everything I can about them. It's the only way I'll be able to find a cure for myself.
What?: There is no cure.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What are you looking at?
What?: What do you see here?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Graffiti --
What?: Look closer.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I know this place -- it's a blood bank.
What?: Owned by vampires. There's one of these in every major city, and just like Domino's, they always deliver.  You telling me you're ready to walk through that door?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You let him go --  An hour ago you were ready to kill a man for less, this one didn't even talk.
What?: He will.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Looks like we hit pay-dirt. This place is crawling with them.  See the valets over there? They're vampires. So is the doorman.
What?: How can you tell?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: So many of them -- I still can't believe they're real.
What?: There are worse things than vampires out there.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Like what?
What?: Like me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What is this place?
What?: Some kind of archive --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Isn't this all a little high-tech? I thought vampires were more into cobwebs and coffins.
What?: You've been watching too much TV. They've got their claws sunk into everything -- finance, real estate, politics. Probably own half of Downtown.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're hurt --
What?: Nothing that won't heal by dawn.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What am I injecting you with?
What?: Serum -- it's a human hemoglobin substitute.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's dark in here.
What?: You get used to the darkness.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I can't close my eyes without hearing her scream.
What?: Those aren't real memories. No one has that kind of recall.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I do. I remember from day one. People staring at me, sensing I was different. Watching the fear grow in their eyes, knowing in their hearts I wasn't human.
What?: If you're not human, then why do you bleed like us? I've seen vampire blood, you don't have it running through your veins.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Just get out of here.
What?: Blade --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I made a trip to the hospital last night, borrowed some equipment.
What?: For your miracle cure?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Is he sick?
What?: Cancer.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You care about him, don't you?
What?: We've got a good arrangement, that's all. Whistler makes the weapons, I use them, the vampires die -- end of story.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: My mother used to say that a cold heart is a dead heart.
What?: Your mother sounds like a Hallmark greeting card.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Any progress?
What?: Some. It's been slow --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You don't look so good.
What?: I'm just tired, that's all. We've been up all night.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: For what it's worth, I'm sorry.
What?: You make it sound like I'm already dead.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Are you all right?
What?: I've been better --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How long have we been driving?
What?: I don't know. I woke up just before you did --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Is it bad?
What?: We get out of this alive, maybe I'll take that miracle cure of yours.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It won't work on you.
What?: What are you talking about?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Get out of here --
What?: I'm not leaving without you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: -- tearing me -- apart.
What?: I know. Take some of my blood.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No --
What?: It's the only way. You know that. We'll never get out of here alive if you don't.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I can't -- I won't be able to stop --
What?: Yes you will. The human side of you is stronger. I know it is.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I never imagined I'd be so happy to see the sun rise --  It's over, isn't it?
What?: For them. But for me --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How's it going, Kam?
What?: You're a week early.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Whistler says I'm building up a resistance to it.
What?: I was afraid that might happen.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Maybe it's time to start exploring other alternatives.
What?: There's only one alternative to the serum.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But you -- died --
What?: Deacon brought me back.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Please --
What?: Listen to your father, Jason. It's going to be a better world.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How could you be a part of this?
What?: These are my people now. I'm one of them.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You don't have to be.
What?: You don't understand. I've killed, I've hunted, and I've enjoyed it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I wish you could see the world as I do. Deacon opened my eyes. There's no turning back from that.
What?: I don't believe that.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: This isn't human blood.
What?: Then what is it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The red blood cells are biconvex, which is theoretically impossible. They're hypochromic, there's virtually no hemoglobin in them.  Look at the PMNs, they're binucleated, they should be mononucleated.
What?: What about the chemistry panel?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Curtis, it's three in the morning. I'm really not in the mood for one of your practical jokes.
What?: It's not a joke. I've got the stiff sitting in the morgue right now -- look, just come up and see him, okay? Five minutes, that's all I ask.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I thought you promised to give me some distance?
What?: This is purely professional curiosity, Karen, I swear.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Five minutes, not a second more. And I don't want to hear a word about "us".
What?: No problem.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You haven't started in on the internal organs?
What?: Just the blood sample from the pericardial sac.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: That's weird --
What?: What?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Tell me something, honestly, you ever have second thoughts about us?
What?: Sometimes --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: -- but then I remember what an ass-hole you were and I'm snapped back to reality.
What?: Jesus, Karen, you're breaking my heart here --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Blade. Once again, our interests have fallen victim to his ridiculous crusade. He must be destroyed.
What?: You're wrong, Dragonetti.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The Day Walker represents a unique opportunity. We'd be fools to waste it by killing him.
What?: Deacon Frost. You refuse to speak our language, you insult the House of Erebus by using the humans' gutter-tongue, have you no respect for tradition?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I see. And what would you have us do with this "half-breed"?
What?: Study him. Unlock the secrets of his DNA. He's the key we've been looking for.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The shadows suit us, Frost. We've existed this way for thousands of years. Who are you to challenge our ways?
What?: Someone who's sick of living off scraps. The coming age belongs to us, not the humans!  When the final war between our races comes, who do you want leading the charge?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: These archives are restricted to members of the House of Erebus.
What?: Please. You and the other Elders wouldn't know what to do with these texts if your lives depended on it.  Which, of course, they do.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're wasting your time, Frost. Far greater scholars than you have tried to decipher these words. Whatever secrets they hold have been lost.
What?: Perhaps.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How do you like that? Right on time.
What?: The other elders will never let you get away with this!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How many of you are there?
What?: A few thousand scattered about the globe. In the past, we've had to restrict our numbers for fear of discovery. That won't be necessary after tonight.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What happens then?
What?: The Blood Tide. Our long-prophesied holy war against the humans. There's a force, you see -- a spirit that exists in our blood. I've discovered a way to invoke it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: LaMagra --
What?: That's right. The answers were there all along, of course, scribbled down in the forgotten languages of my kind. Waiting for someone with the patience to decipher them. My elders were foolish enough to dismiss them as wives tales. But I knew better.  Imagine my surprise when Blade turned out to be the key which would set that force free.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: LaMagra isn't a physical being. He's a spirit, requiring a flesh and blood host in order to manifest himself.
What?: You.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: There's no need for any of this. Your condition can be treated. Whistler and I were working on a cure when --
What?: What makes you think we want to be cured? Blood is only part of the equation. The hunt, the killing, that's what the Thirst is really about.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But you use blood banks --
What?: Only as a last resort. Preserved blood is inferior. There's no flavor left to it, no life.  Fortunately, I've found a way around that particular obstacle.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're a monster.
What?: Why? Because we live at another species' expense? Your people farm cattle and veal, don't they? Fattening them up with steroids? It's called evolution, Doctor. Survival of the fittest.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Blade --
What?: You're wasting your breath, woman. He can't hear you now. It's the Thirst, you see? It already has him in its grip.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I was wrong about you, Blade. You were never one of us. You're a traitor to your race.
What?: Get away from him!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What -- ?
What?: You've been bitten by a vampire. We've got to try and burn out the venom, just like a rattlesnake bite --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Who are you people?
What?: My name is Abraham Whistler.  This is Blade. As for our little homunculus here --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: So what do you use, then? A stake?
What?: Some of the old wives' tales are true -- they're severely allergic to silver, various types of wood. Feed them garlic and they'll go into anaphylactic shock --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Consider it a parting gift. Vampire mace -- silver nitrate, essence of garlic.
What?: So that's it? You guys just patch me up and send me on my way?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We keep in radio contact.
What?: You've been listening in the whole time?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Whistler!
What?: Go on, I'll be fine!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why didn't you tell me the truth about him?
What?: We weren't sure we could trust you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Blade's unique, you know. A one in a billion anomaly. He can withstand sunlight, garlic, even silver. But he still has the Thirst.
What?: What happens if he doesn't take the serum?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The Thirst overcomes him, just like the others. It's not something he can control.  The problem is, time's running out. His body's starting to reject the serum. And so far, all my efforts to find a cure have ended in failure --
What?: No offense, Whistler, but you're not exactly working with state of the art equipment here. You might have missed something.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why do you hunt them?
What?: Habit, mostly, just like this.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I had a family once -- a wife, three daughters. Then a drifter named Deacon Frost came calling one evening --
What?: He killed them?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How did you escape?
What?: I didn't. He was cruel enough to let me live.  Even gave me a souvenir to remember him by.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And now you're using Blade to exact your revenge?
What?: Frost's bodycount keeps rising, and I'm not getting any younger, am I?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I wouldn't go in there if I were you. It's best to leave him alone when he's like this.
What?: I'll take my chances.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: All right, let's start with the basics -- why do vampires need to drink blood?
What?: Their own blood can't sustain hemoglobin.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Basically you'd have to re-write the victim's DNA, alter it so that the DNA will produce proteins capable of generating hemoglobin.
What?: How?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: On me, yes. On Blade, I'm not so sure --  The problem is, Blade didn't contract the vampire virus from a bite like I did. He was born with it. The irony is, I could probably cure every vampire but him.
What?: Then we're back to square one, aren't we? Sooner or later, the Thirst always wins.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What happened to the power?
What?: I don't know, but the back-up generator should've kicked in.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: ...ervices.
What?: Uh - what? - I ...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: ...Be back.
What?: Thank you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: ...ergency procedures.
What?: I haven't got an emergency. Get out of here.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: ...your ducts?
What?: I fixed it myself.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: ... And then some.
What?: What have you done to my flat?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You telephone, sir.
What?: ...elephoned sir.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Trouble with your air-conditioning.
What?: ...ditioning.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: ...ixed itself.
What?: Machines don't fix themselves.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: ... fix themselves.
What?: He's tampered with it, Dowser.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I think we'd better have a look.
What?: ... have a look.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What have you got there?
What?: Got there!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mumble ... mumble ... mumble ... Tuttle
What?: Mumble ... Tuttle ...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Tuttle! ... mumble!  You've had that scab Tuttle here, haven't you?
What?: ...aven't you?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh yeh? Where'd you get this from eh  out yer nostril?
What?: ...Yer nostril?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Central Services don't take kindly to sabotage!
What?: ...sabotage!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: ...ven't you?
What?: You're putting your talents to very odd use Mr Lowry - yes, odd use - to pit wits against Central Services -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sign here, please.
What?: ... ere please.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: This is what you get when you have cowboys round yer ducts.
What?: ... yer ducts.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I think you've got your T41 crystal inductor wired up to a reverse bobbin- threaded-solenoid-control. It's either that or a new washer.
What?: ... new washer.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sign the form so we can get to it.
What?: ... get to it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ah ha ... there you are, Sam.
What?: What? How do you know my name?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We know everything here. This is the Storeroom of Knowledge.
What?: Then perhaps you can help me. I've lost someone who ...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh, yes. We've got everything here. Every bit of knowledge, wisdom, learning ... every experience, every thought neatly filed away.
What?: What? You mean you've got ...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well not exactly. But, if you help us we'll help you. The Forces Of Darkness have won the day ... but, tomorrow is another one
What?: What do I have to do.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Er ... Thanks ...
What?: It's reply paid.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh ...  Thank you very much, mother, but actually -
What?: You don't have to sing it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Aren't you a bit late? - the party started half an hour ago.
What?: Yes, I know. It's the backlog, everybody complains. Was it all right otherwise?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes, it was ... very nice ... thank you.
What?: Do you mind if I use your bathroom?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Go away.
What?: Her name is Jill.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What? ...Jill? Jill who? Jill who?
What?: Layton.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jill Layton ...  You're a very good little girl. What are you doing here?
What?: I'm waiting for my daddy.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Deputy minister, what do you believe is behind this recent increase in terrorist bombings?
What?: Bad sportsmanship. A ruthless minority of people seems to have forgotten certain good old fashioned virtues. They just can't stand seeing the other fellow win. If these people would just play the game, instead of standing on the touch line heckling -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: In fact, killing people -
What?: - In fact, killing people - they'd get a lot more out of life.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mr. HELPMANN, what would you say to those critics who maintain that the Ministry Of Information has become too large and unwieldy ...?
What?: David ... in a free society information is the name of the game. You can't win the game if you're a man short.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And the cost of it all, Deputy Minister? Seven percent of the gross national produce ...
What?: I understand this concern on behalf of the tax-payers. People want value for money and a cost-effective service.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Do you think that the government is winning the battle against terrorists?
What?: On yes. Our morale is much higher than theirs, we're fielding all their strokes, running a lot of them out, and pretty consistently knocking them for six. I'd say they're nearly out of the game.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But the bombing campaign is now in its thirteenth year ...
What?: Beginner's luck.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Thank you very much, Deputy Minister.
What?: Thank you, David ... and a very merry Christmas to you all.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Thanks very much Sam.
What?: That's all right Mr Helpmann. Glad to help.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: If I can help you ...
What?: Well, I ...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sorry ...
What?: Your father and I were very close. Of course Jeremiah was senior to me but we were close friends ... especially after the bombing  and I  keep his name alive at the office every day.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I know he would have wanted me to help you ... And I promised your mother I'd take you onto the team at information Retrieval. But I gather that ...
What?: Mr Helpmann. I've changed my mind. I'd like to accept the transfer - am I too late?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Too late? That's for me to say.
What?: Well ... well, I ...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sam, what are we going to do with you? Can you hear me, Sam?
What?: Where's Jill? What have you done to her? Where is she?!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Gillian Layton?
What?: Yes, you've got to get me out of here. I've got to find her.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Help me!
What?: I assure you, Sam, I'm doing everything within my power. But the rules of the game are laid down, and we all have to play by them - even me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: This is all a mistake! Don't you understand?!
What?: Yes, well, from the Department's point of view you're certainly a bit of an own goal, but ...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm not a terrorist! You must know that! I'm not guilty! Get me out of here!
What?: Sam, if you've been going out there and playing a straight bat, all the way down the line, you've got absolutely nothing to worry about.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Please, I've got to find Jill.
What?: Sam, I think I ought to tell you ... I'm afraid she's upped stumps and retired to the pavilion.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes, it's all a bit confusing but, it seems she was killed resisting arrest.
What?: No, no ... I did that...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sam!
What?: Jack!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Long time no see!
What?: Well, since you disappeared up the ladder of Information Retrieval ... I don't expect to see you slumming in Records - what's the problem?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Problem? - No problem - yes, everything's going fantastically well, wonderful, marvelous, great career prospects, Alison in great shape, kids fine, beautiful home, I'm on Security Level Five now, and Mr Helpmann relies on me more and more, yes, couldn't be better, I feel terrifically motivated and job- rewarded -
What?: You sound worried.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What's the matter?
What?: Sorry. Nothing.  See you - I'm going to be late.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You are late.
What?: Even later.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sam, your life is going wrong - let your friends tell you - Records is a dead end department, no Security Level worth a damn, it's impossible to get noticed -
What?: Yes, I know, fantastic, marvellous, wonderful - remember me to Alison - and the - er - twins.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Triplets.
What?: Really? - God, how time flies!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Hello, Jack!
What?: You remember Alison?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: {winking at Sam) She doesn't like me telling anyone but she's pleased as anything really.
What?: Er, I knew you looked different.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Remember how they used to stick out?
What?: What? - Oh, yes - vividly. I used to wonder if they were real.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Dr. Jaffe has pinned her ears back.
What?: Quite, absolutely - I always thought they were false.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jack!!
What?: SAM! What a surprise!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sorry about that ... Mr Helpmann told me you were coming aboard - congratulations!
What?: Thanks. Are you officer 412/L?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: For my sins. Are you settling in alright?
What?: Yes, thanks.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Terrific. I'm really glad you dropped by. Unfortunately, I don't have any time right now I've got a queue of customers to deal with - er, why don't we have a drink tonight?
What?: Ah ...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What?
What?: I don't want to take up your time now, but I was hoping you could give me some information on somebody. It's a security level three matter and Information Retrieval records says to refer to you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: OK. Come back this afternoon, about four o'clock. If you give me the number of the case, I'll have the dossier here waiting.  My tailor,... well worth the investment.
What?: I've got numbers all over these - I'm not sure which is the one you want.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Layton! Oh shit!
What?: What is it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You clever bastard! I might have guessed. You only moved in today and you're already hot on the bloody trail.
What?: Am I?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Please, Sam, we're going to have to be open to each other on this one. If you make a reputation with this case, it'll be at my expense.
What?: How do you mean?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How much do you know?
What?: Not much.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Enough though, eh?
What?: Not really, no.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: OK. OK. Let's not fence around ... This is the situation. Some idiot somewhere in the building, some insect, confused two of our clients, B58/732 and T47/215.
What?: B58/732, that's A. Buttle isn't it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Christ! You do know it all!
What?: No, no, I don't. I'm just beginning Honestly. Sorry, carry on.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well, your A. Buttle has been confused with T47/215, an A. Tuttle. I mean, it's a joke! Somebody should be shot for that. So B58/732 was pulled in by mistake.
What?: You got the wrong man.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I did not get the wrong man. I got the right man. The wrong man was delivered to me as the right man! I accepted him, on trust, as the right man. Was I wrong? Anyway, to add to the confusion, he died on us. Which, had he been the right man, he wouldn't have done.
What?: You killed him?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sam, there are very rigid parameters laid down to avoid that event but Buttle's heart condition did not appear on Tuttle's file. Don't think I'm dismissing this business, Sam. I've lost a week's sleep over it already.
What?: I'm sure you have

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: There are some real bastards in this department who don't mind breaking a few eggs to make an omelette, but thank God there are the new boys like me who want to maintain decent civilized standards of terrorist eradication. We've got the upper hand for the moment, but they're waiting for us to slip up, and a little slip- up like this is just the chance they're looking for.
What?: So how ...?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What I've got to do now is pick up Tuttle, interrogate him at the same voltage as Buttle, to the same meter reading to the last penny, and juggle the books in electrical banking.
What?: What has Tuttle done?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We suspect him of freelance subversion.
What?: He's a freelance subversive?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What's she done?
What?: You didn't know as much about this business as you pretended to, did you?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Er ... no.
What?: Very smart.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Er ... but I would've found out anyway.
What?: Yes. I'm impressed.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Tell me about Layton.
What?: She witnessed the Tuttle arrest - the Buttle arrest - and since then she's been making wild allegations, obviously trying to exploit the situation - she's working for somebody, and she's not working for us.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But surely, I mean, perhaps she just happened to live above the Buttles, and ...
What?: Look after that suit, eh. Barbara chose it for me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Right. Er, you're not going to keep calling her Barbara, are you?
What?: Barbara's a perfectly good name, isn't it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Look, about the Layton woman - maybe she's just trying to help the Buttle family.
What?: Why?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why? Hell, not for any reason ...
What?: {baffled) I don't follow you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Out of kindness.
What?: Kindness? What's the purpose behind this line of enquiry?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: So what are you going to do about her?
What?: Get her out of circulation - I've put her on the detention list.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You mean you're going to invite her in so that she can spill the beans inside the department?
What?: Well, I ... Good point. What do you suggest?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Let me try to get to her. I'll deactivate her.
What?: What does that mean? I don't want to be involved in anything unsavoury.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Trust me. You do trust me, don't you?
What?: Of course. We went to school together. You're my oldest friend.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And you're mine.
What?: You're the only person I can trust.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Then we'd better keep this business just between the two of us.
What?: Right! Just between as and the Security Forces.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They weren't at school with us.
What?: But, I've already put her on the search and detain list.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Grandma, look at me!
What?: I see you! Riding pretty high, ain't you? Look out you don't fall off.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Howdy, Jabez.
What?: Howdy, Hank.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Kin you spare a moment for me Jabez?
What?: Why, of course, Hank -- I've always got time for a neighbor. What's on your mind?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well -- here's how it is ...Tom Sharp, Eli Higgins and a couple of others been talking to me about -- that new sort of organization -- grange they call it. What you think about it?
What?: I don't know -- don't seem much of an idea to me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes, but what does a farmer do if he don't want to get roped in some more by them loan sharks?
What?: Oh -- you don't have to go to Miser Stevens while I'm around.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Don't I? ... Say, that's mighty white of you, Jabez.
What?: Not at all, Hank ... not at all. Glad to help you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Say ... about the interest ...
What?: Now don't you worry about that. You just leave it all to me. We won't talk business now ... just bear this in mind ... I'm not the man to get rich on other people's hard luck.... No, sir... not me! ...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Loan shark -- hey?
What?: Too bad it didn't happen to Miser Stevens.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Are you one of old Stevens' customers too?
What?: Sure am.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sure does. But I'll have to sleep on it a couple of nights.
What?: That's fair enough, Jabez. Man's got a right to mull things over. We'll drive round again, week or so.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I am just thinkin' -- now they mightn't like the idea down in Washington.
What?: Why not! There's a bill up in Congress to give us a uniform law of bankruptcy. Daniel Webster is fighting for it right now--

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What do you want?
What?: Howdy, Mr. Stone. We've come round to ask you if you made up your mind to join the Grange?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What Grange?
What?: That farmers' association -- we were talking about the other day.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well -- we don't mean to force you, Jabez Stone -- but -- it's only for your own good.
What?: I'll look out for myself! ... Now go away -- leave me alone.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jabez -- will you join our Grange now?
What?: Why, thank you, Tom. I was going to ask you if you thought I could.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're not -- Dorothy.
What?: No. She's gone.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: She couldn't be gone!
What?: But she is -- I've taken her place. Don't you remember -- you wrote me a letter. Mrs. Stone was too ill.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Never mind. What's your name?
What?: Belle.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Stevens!
What?: Well, Stone -- have you got the money?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I barely managed to scrape up a bit for you. I thought if I made a kind of part payment --
What?: No, Stone!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: -- in gold.
What?: I'd like to know where you'd get it....

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You know -- some folks are just lucky. Others pick gold right out of the air.  Like that!
What?: Real! Sheriff, you are a witness that this money is paid me voluntarily, and while it does not satisfy the mortgage, it has become my property.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mornin', Jabez ...
What?: Hello, Stevens ... you're early today.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes, I wanted to get here before the others.... I want to talk to you alone.
What?: Some other time, Stevens.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Good evening -- I'm sorry, Jabez -- I'm a little late.
What?: No, you're not.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Where's everybody?
What?: I dunno -- I can't figure it out. I've invited them all. Why don't they come?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Now run along, Daniel.
What?: What a fine boy you have, Jabez. How old is he now?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Almost seven.  No -- no, he's not seven yet I am sure --
What?: Well -- it seems to me -- I remember when you paid me--

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What's the matter with you?
What?: You are afraid!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Afraid ... of what?
What?: -- of what happens after we die!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Are you plumb crazy, man! What do you think happens? We're buried -- that's all.
What?: But what becomes of our souls?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why do you fret about something that isn't there?
What?: Don't say that -- I know it is --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: All right -- so it's buried with you!
What?: What if one hasn't a soul any more? What of that?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Huh? -- What's that?  Well -- what about it? Who cares, anyhow?
What?: I do -- and I think you should too.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Do you deny that you called me? I've known people in other States who went back on their word. But I didn't expect it in New Hampshire.
What?: You can't say that to me! I'm New Hampshire. If I say I called you, I did.  I guess I did.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You've had a lot of bad luck these days. And yet -- it's all so unnecessary. When I think of your opportunities --
What?: Opportunities?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Of course. Why man, you have one of the richest farms in the county.  You just go about it the wrong way -- so many men do. Hard work -- well, that's all right for people who don't know how to do anything else. It's all right for people who aren't lucky -- but once you're lucky -- you don't work for other people. You make them work for you.
What?: Well, now, Mister, that sounds all right. But--

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Where did it come from?
What?: Oh, you know the old story -- the Hessian wagon train that was ambushed on the way to Saratoga. Some of the gold has been buried under your barn!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes, why shouldn't it?
What?: Yes, of course, people forgot -- or the men who knew about it died, you know how these things happen.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's mine?
What?: That's right, Mr. Stone -- there is --  -- just one little formality. I'd like your signature here -- see. And when it's done -- it's done for seven years.  It's our usual form. Of course -- we may be able to take up the question of a renewal in due time.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What does it mean here -- about my soul?
What?: Well, why should that worry you. A soul -- a soul is nothing. Can you see it, smell it, touch it? -- No! -- Think of it -- this soul -- your soul -- a nothing, against seven whole years of good luck! You will have money and all that money can buy. Upon my word, Neighbor Stone, if it weren't for my firm's reputation for generous dealing--

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No, no! Give it to me!
What?: A pin, Neighbor Stone! I'm afraid, you'll have to prick your finger -- but what's a little pain to a lucky man?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Excellent. A firm, fair signature. One that will last till doomsday.  My dear Neighbor Stone, I congratulate you! You're going to be the richest man in New Hampshire!
What?: Well, I'll be --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes, indeed. But not now. Not for seven years. Oh, I almost forgot -- what is the date?
What?: The seventh day of April --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Good evening, Neighbor Stone.
What?: Look here now--

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh come, Neighbor Stone. I wouldn't cut that tree if I were you. It means a breach of contract.
What?: I don't care.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But you should, now that you are becoming a father.
What?: Leave your tongue off of that!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why, Mr. Stone, you look so worried. Can I be of any service?
What?: You promised me prosperity, happiness, love, money, friendship --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: .... Miser Stevens' soul, Mr. Stone. Yes -- I am sorry for the disturbance.
What?: He ain't dead -- he's dancing in there.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Are they all as -- small -- as that?
What?: Small? Oh, I see what you mean. Why, they vary.  Now a man like Daniel Webster, if I ever get hold of him, I'd have to build a special box for him and even at that, I imagine, the wing spread would be astonishing.  In your case --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Trying to break our contract again, Mr. Stone?
What?: I'm through with you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What a headstrong fellow! Well -- I guess you're quite prepared to suffer the consequences.
What?: I have still a year -- a year to make up for everything.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh no, you violated clause five of our contract and I could collect right now, if I chose.
What?: Not now! Not now!  -- Let me make up -- let me make up.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Suddenly you seem quite desperate, Mr. Stone --  -- You know I'm a good-natured man. I'm always open to reason. With a little security -- I might--
What?: Anything -- anything. -- You can have it all back -- that money -- the new house -- my farm -- the whole caboodle!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm afraid that's hardly the sort of security I was thinking of --  You see -- there is that promising little fellow, your son ...
What?: No! No! No! Not him -- not my son -- I'd rather go with you -- right now.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well now, Mr. Stone, did you make up your mind?
What?: About what?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Are you willing to give me your son in exchange for an extension of our contract?
What?: Never!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jabez Stone -- did you or did you not sign this document?
What?: Yes, I did -- but you tricked me into signing it! You told me my soul was nothing ... that I could forget all about a soul, in exchange for money. That was a lie, a lie, a lie.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes -- yes, I am the richest man -- too rich. I can't think of anything but money. That's the trouble with me.
What?: But, Mr. Stone, I am hardly to blame for the pricking of your wholly unnecessary conscience.  Is this your signature?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You know darn well it is.
What?: Gentlemen, the prosecution rests.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ten throws -- Mr. Webster?
What?: Ten throws it is.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You win. Will you ride to the village with me, Mr. Stone?
What?: Thank you, Mr. Webster.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I don't seem to be so very popular after all -- in Cross Corners.
What?: Seems like it's my fault, Mr. Webster.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Here's a man who knows what's good for Dan'l Webster! Medford rum! Ah, a breath of the Promised Land!  To the champion of the Iron Horseshoe, Jabez Stone!
What?: Thanks, Mr. Webster!  To the champion of the whole United States -- Dan'l Webster!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Eloquent speech, Neighbor Stone -- couldn't have done better myself --  -- under the circumstances.  Thank you.
What?: Mr. Webster -- I'd like you to meet my wife, Mary.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well -- Mr. Webster! This is a great day for me. Come on in, sir. I want you to take the seat of honor and meet all my guests!
What?: That's just fine, Neighbor Stone -- but -- I have to be pretty careful of my seats of honor -- where I sit, I mean. You see, the whole country sort of has its eye on me, Jabez -- anybody in public life has that difficulty -- even you, Jabez. They watch us carefully, our neighbors and our enemies, and they see much more than we think they do -- and understand much more. My friends all like to think that I've got the good of mankind always at heart, and I've got to make sure that those I deal with have the good of mankind always at heart, too. Do you know what I'm talking about, Jabez?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What -- what's on your mind?
What?: You, Jabez Stone -- you and a lot of poor farmers, hereabouts -- good men of the earth who are in trouble because of you. Or -- am I wrong about those contracts, Mr. Stone?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Contracts? -- Yes, they have contracts with me -- lots of 'em -- but -- but that's all right. Without me and my money, they wouldn't have anything.
What?: They'd have a good neighbor, Jabez -- and that's worth much more than anything else -- much, much more!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm sorry you can't see that, I know you could once -- you made a little speech once, that I'll always remember and I know the others do too --  They remember and they see how you have changed. That's why they didn't want to come tonight to you, Jabez -- you're as blind as a Burma bat, with your gold pot! Mind you, it's not the money, I've been talking about, it's what you make of it.
What?: I -- I don't know what you're talking about! I -- I haven't time to listen to all this --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No -- you haven't time -- You haven't time for your mother, or your wife, or your child.
What?: It's your fault! You brought Daniel Webster here -- just to try to make a fool of me! You played the sneak behind my back -- made up all sorts of lies against me! You can get yourself out of my home -- go back to the other house -- that old place, where you belong -- I don't want to -- to talk to you again!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's here you said that you closed the deal with him?
What?: Yes, Mr. Webster -- it was here where it all began.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I see. And this is where he'd like to collect, too.
What?: Yes -- at midnight.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They make plucky women in New England.  H'm ... how long have we to wait?
What?: Not long -- now.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: There's nothing like it. I saw an inchworm take a drop of it once, and he stood right up on his hind legs and bit a bee. Come -- try a nip!
What?: There's no joy in it for me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You were worried, Jabez, weren't you?
What?: Well, I --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ma says breakfast's ready, Mr. Webster!
What?: Breakfast ... Ah! ... Come along friends, Ma Stone's a cook this side of heaven.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Coming along, Jabez?
What?: Shall we?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why -- good morning, Squire.
What?: Morning, Jabez.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ahem -- we want to have a little confidential talk with you, Neighbor Stone. Don't like to take a man away from his planting -- but sometimes --
What?: Come right into the parlor, won't you, folks.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mighty good of you to come out, Squire -- sparing all this time to --  Sheriff, too -- and Schoolmaster -- mighty nice.
What?: Ahem -- Neighbor Stone, we want--

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh!
What?: Headache -- Squire?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Worst I had in years -- ahem -- starting a spring cold, I guess -- er -- don't happen to have a bit of camomile tea in the house, do you, Stone?
What?: Camomile tea!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And so, Jabez Stone, in the name of the Whig Party of Cross Corners, we offer you the nomination of that party for Selectman.
What?: Selectman? Selectman of the village? Me?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But -- I was just lucky.
What?: Well? Don't a politician have to be?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Howdy, Squire! Howdy! Oh -- how do you do, Squire.
What?: How do you do, Belle? How are you, Jabez?  Well -- mighty elegant house you got here.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well, Jabez -- I'm a little pressed for time. You wanted to discuss something -- some business --
What?: Oh yes -- yes. Won't take a minute. Can you keep a secret?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why of course --
What?: Dan'l Webster is coming to my party.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Dan'l Webster?
What?: Yes -- and that's the reason I wanted to talk with you. You got my invitation?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes.
What?: Now look -- here's a list of the people I invited -- they're all the right kind of people -- or did I miss anybody?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The only one you missed -- is the President.
What?: You think that's a joke? I had him on there too, but I was afraid Dan'l Webster might feel insulted.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You keep that -- that's for you. I want you to talk up the party to make sure that the best folks really come.
What?: You want me to go around --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes  siree -- that's the idea. Get them all here and then say: "Look, folks -- here's Daniel Webster, my guest of honor." Golly, I can see their eyes pop already.
What?: You mean that's all you had me come out here for?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Now, Squire, you're not going to let me down. We still want to do a lot of business together, don't we?
What?: Well -- yes --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: That's fine. Now you can tell people all about the house, but don't mention Webster.
What?: You are not so sure that he'll come.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh yes -- I am -- want to bet?
What?: Why not -- ?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How much?
What?: 5000 -- that's just what I owe you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jabez -- help!
What?: Coming.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Down, Shep! Down!
What?: He only wants you to throw the stick for him, Jabez. I guess he's feeling the spring a-coming, too.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What is that smile on your face?  Is there anything wrong with me?
What?: Now, Jabez! I've got on my Sunday bonnet and I'm going to church with my husband. Almost the first time since the beginning of winter -- and if that isn't an occasion, I don't know what is.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I think his leg is broken.
What?: Oh, Jabez.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I remember Dad used to say sometimes, when they were handing out hard luck, the farmers got there first.
What?: Jabez, don't you remember your own wedding? We said it's for better or worse. We said it's for richer or poorer.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He's stubborn as a Stone.
What?: Hold the splint tighter -- it's almost done.  Go on reading, Ma. This man, Job, he had troubles, didn't he?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well, I'll be -- there's a rig, turning in, by the gate.
What?: Who is it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: " ... and if the final vote shall leave thousands of our fellow citizens and their families in hopeless distress, can we -- members of the Government -- go to our beds with a clear conscience, can we, without self- reproach, supplicate the Almighty Mercy to forgive us our debts as we forgive our debtors?
What?: That's wonderful language. It would move a stone.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well -- what are we going to do?
What?: We can still use my butter money.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Your butter money?
What?: Do you think I'm grudging it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mary -- it's gone.
What?: Not all of it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes -- I had to pay the vet in full. He just wouldn't have treated the horse this time. After all, we can't very well do without a horse.
What?: It's all right, Jabez. We'll find something to pay Stevens.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: If the pig hadn't broke his leg, we could have taken him.
What?: Jabez! Couldn't you take a sack of seed instead?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: To save us work on the spring plowing?
What?: You always said, the field uphill needs a rest, but if you think --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mary, I'm a farmer -- always will be. To me seed isn't a thing to pay debts with, it's alive, more alive than anything -- but I guess you're right. We just got to do it. Oh -- how's it all going to end?
What?: Jabez -- you ought to talk to Tom about joining the Grange.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jabez!
What?: Seed alone won't do, Mary. We have to throw the calf in.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh Jabez! And we were counting on ...  It's a lovely calf.
What?: You're right, Mary it's a fine calf. That's why Stevens'll take it for the rest of the payment.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mary--
What?: Jabez ...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'll get the doctor.
What?: No, Jabez -- all I need is some rest -- You go and pay our debt. Everything'll be all right then ... everything.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mary -- what would you do with a pot o' gold?
What?: Jabez!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mary -- what would you do?
What?: Well -- I -- I don't know -- I would pay our debts and well -- maybe get a new bonnet, but -- really -- I think I would live the same.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It feels fine now, Jabez.
What?: Will you come into town with me tomorrow?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What do you think of that, Jabez?
What?: Looks right elegant, Mary.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We must go on home, Jabez.
What?: Yes, Mary.  It's been a long day.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Remember, Mary, how he said it: "Couldn't have done better myself, Jabez Stone," and it was my first speech. I don't know what came into me, Mary. I just stood up and the words came flowing like water out of my mouth.
What?: Oh, Jabez -- it was a wonderful day --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But I'm glad to be home again --
What?: Tired?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Worried!
What?: There is nothing to worry about now.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You'll never change -- will you?
What?: Mary -- you just wait and see -- It's all -- just the beginning -- just the beginning -- of everything. I'll be the biggest man in New Hampshire and you'll be the wife of the biggest man.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: There's hope and promise in it, Jabez -- Planting and promise of good harvest to come.
What?: Yes -- you are right, Mary. I can almost hear the little blades of grass a-starting up -- All the seeds a-stirring underneath the ground --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mary --
What?: Jabez --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mary, get three cups of camomile tea for the Squire and the rest. They all feel colds coming on.
What?: I'll get it, Jabez.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mary! I'm -- Selectman of Cross Corners!
What?: Oh -- Jabez.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You could have knocked me down with a feather -- Selectman -- me.
What?: I'll never get my washing done.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: That's one thing I want to talk to you about, Mary.
What?: Yes, Mr. Selectman!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm serious.
What?: It's very becoming to you, Mr. Selectman.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But it's not very becoming to you to have your hands in the suds -- when the Squire and his wife --
What?: But Jabez -- the washing has to be done --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well -- that's the last time -- we'll have servants to do it.
What?: No, no. I don't want to be idle.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jabez -- once you said we'd never change --
What?: I wasn't used to being big -- wasn't used to thinking in big ways. Now, I've made up my mind.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ruined -- all the fields -- ruined.
What?: Mary -- but look -- it didn't touch an ear of my corn -- we'll have a rich harvest.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mary --
What?: Hello, Jabez --  Here's your son.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well -- I -- I-
What?: Don't be cross with him, Ma. This don't happen every day.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Potato bug sits on the leaf in the sun, Sleep, sleep, my baby -- Raccoon sits in the spruce all night, Sleep, baby, sleep --
What?: What in sugar hill's the matter with him?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What happened.... Where are you taking him?
What?: I am going to lock him up.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jabez -- how can you let her talk like that when the boy is present? He won't respect me any more.
What?: Isn't that your own fault?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: My fault? ... Oh, Jabez -- all I want is to be proud of him. He can be such a fine boy, if we show him how to be.
What?: He's my son and I like him the way he is. Why do you always have to pick on him? If it's not the boy it's me. You don't like the way I live -- you don't like my friends, or my new house -- or anything.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But Jabez, I never said that!
What?: It shows on your face.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well -- I am worried about the way you've changed. That was one thing you said you'd never do -- remember?
What?: Oh, for heaven's sake, leave me alone!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why don't they come --
What?: I don't know, Jabez.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Think this room is larger than anything Webster's got at Marshfield? You've been there. What about it, Mary?
What?: It's -- different, Jabez -- that's all.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mr. Webster ... Wait! ...  Mary!
What?: Jabez!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mary! Come back ...
What?: Oh, Jabez! ...  Did you hear, Mr. Webster? --  Now you'll help him, won't you?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You must go now, Mary -- you must!
What?: All right, Jabez ...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jabez -- Jabez!
What?: Mary!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: "There was a man in the land of Uz whose name was Job
What?: Consarn the consarn --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Jabez! What kind of talk is that for the Sabbath? And me a-reading the holy word!
What?: Sorry, Ma -- but this consar-- this little pig --  He won't let me fix him --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You know that, son.
What?: Hard luck -- like me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Now, Jabez Stone -- as for what you're calling hard luck -- well, we made New England out of it. That and codfish.
What?: That's right, Ma -- we ain't licked yet. A Stone's never licked till he's dead -- that's what Dad used to say, didn't he, Ma?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: There! Guess that ought to hold good. Put him down here, by the fire, Mary.  But we don't want to get him too close -- we'll have roast pork for supper.
What?: Not on the Sabbath you won't, Jabez!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How'd you know to have the calf ready, Ma?
What?: I just figgered -- knew you didn't have enough bills.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes -- and you figgered right, consarn it!
What?: That's a word you're too free with lately, Jabez, consarn this and consarn that ...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Helps sometimes to say it.
What?: All right, son -- if it helps.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What's ailing that dog?
What?: I dunno.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well ... make him keep quiet.
What?: And why should I? Let him howl if it makes him feel good.  Consarn it. He's better off than I am! I wish I could tell Him...  ... up there, just what I think.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Hush up such talk, Jabez!
What?: I can't help it. I mean it, I tell you. I've had more than my share. Nothing ever goes right for me -- nothing!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You found it in the barn, hey?
What?: Yes -- I was getting the seed -- I stumbled -- I saw one of the boards warped up a bit -- and -- there it was.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Money -- money's a funny thing, ain't it, Ma?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Do you really think that?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ma -- is she? --

I've seen him get hard and mean, and he isn't hard or mean. I've heard him mock at the church bells -- the bells that rang for our wedding. Don't you think it kind of defeats the: A Tibanna gas mine.  Lando won it in a sabacc match, or so he claims. Lando and I go way back.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I feel cold.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Ben?  Ben?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I see them! ... They're in pain ... they're suffering.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They're my friends.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes, yes.  To Obi-wan you listen young one.  The tree.  Remember your failure at the tree!  Heh?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The Hoth System?
What?: Yes, Sir .... we have visuals ... the System is supposed to be devoid of human forms ...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes, My Lord.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: There is one thing left to do... Excalibur... And you must do it, Perceval. Leave my wounds, I command you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: My King, I couldn't do it. Excalibur cannot be lost. Other men--

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Good day to you, sir.
What?: Move aside. This is the King's road, and the knights you joined arms against were his very own.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I await the King himself. His knights are in need of training.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yield. I have the advantage.
What?: I will not.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Fight me from your horse or on foot, but fight me. Your avoidance mocks me.
What?: I sought only not to harm you, sir.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sir, your rage has unbalanced you. It seems you would fight to the death against a knight who is not your enemy, for a length of road you can ride around.
What?: So be it, to the death.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Thanks to God, you are alive.
What?: I, the best knight in the world, bested! This is a great day, for my search is over. I love you, my King.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You are still the best knight in Christiandom. You gained a hundred advantages over me. It is I who must love you, for through your courage and patience you taught me a bitter lesson.
What?: Then make me your champion and I will always fight in your place.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But your life and lands are far from here.
What?: I gave up my castles and my lands!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: My domain is here, inside this metal skin. And I would pledge to you all that I still own: muscle, bone, blood and the heart that pumps it.
What?: And a great heart it is. Sir Lancelot, you will be my champion.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Lancelot, how did you fare in the North?
What?: We spared the lives of a few, so they could sail home and tell their fellows what fate they met at the hands of King Arthur's knights...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: These men repented before God for their evil deeds. Those who would not, met their fate at the end of my sword.  Accept the fruit of my first quest as my wedding gift.
What?: I do. Rise, Lancelot, come with me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Your deeds set an example for all other knights. For your gift, ask a gift of me.
What?: Only give me leave to ride out again, to do what I am most able to do, and happiest doing.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They miss the battlefield. I think we do too.
What?: But one can still keep a sword sharp riding out in the name of the King's law.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Hasn't Merlin mended your wound?
What?: It is deep...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Arthur.
What?: Lancelot, I will save you... Don't die.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: My salvation is to die a Knight of the Round Table.
What?: You are that and much more. You are its greatest knight, you are what is best in men. Now we will be together--

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: At last...
What?: Don't recognize him. You were trapped by Morgana's sorcery.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Perceval, you have returned!
What?: Ready my knights for battle

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Merlin, will I live...?  ...I was dreaming...
What?: Of Merlin?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes. He spoke to me. He said I would fight bravely tomorrow. I have never dreamed of Merlin before.
What?: I dreamed of him too... Merlin lives! He lives in our dreams now, in that dark and shadowy place that is as strong and real as this more solid one. He speaks to us from there.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He can be no other.
What?: Lancelot?... It is Lancelot!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Who is Merlin?
What?: Speak of the devil!...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Whose son am I?
What?: You are the son of King Uther, and the fair Igrayne... you are King Arthur.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You saved me from the arrow...
What?: But not from your destiny.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I want to thank you.
What?: That's not why you came.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Merlin, help me. I need your help. I don't know how--
What?: 'Help me, Help me.' Help me get up.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It is whispered in the forest that...  ...Leondegrance's castle is under siege by Lot and Uryens.
What?: Yes, yes, I know that. Everybody does. Lord Leondegrance is my only ally among the barons and the great knights. I can't lose him.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well there. You don't need me half as much as you think you do. You already know what must not happen.
What?: I must find the means to save him, then. I was hoping I could ask you for a little magic help, but if it makes you so tired...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's just that I have no experience, and no men to speak of. How can I--
What?: Because you must! You and only you. Have you forgotten that it was you who freed Excalibur?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How? Where?
What?: In the great book.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What book is that?
What?: The book without pages. Open before you, all around us. You can see it in bits and pieces, for if mortal men were to see it whole and all complete in a single glance, why, it would burn him to cinders.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What?!
What?: The dragon! There...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Then as knight to knight I can offer you mercy.
What?: What's this, what's this?!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: A king must marry, after all.
What?: ...of course...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I love her. If she would be my queen, my dreams would be answered.
What?: There are maidens as fair, and fairer than Guenevere. If I put my mind to it, I could see them now, many of them, weeping for love of you, watching the hills for you coming from the high towers of their castles. Offering you their every favor. Rich, clever--but if it is to be Guenevere, so be it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Who will it be? Put your mind to it, then.
What?: Guenevere. And a beloved friend who will betray you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Guenevere...
What?: You're not listening. Your heart is not. Love is deaf as well as blind.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I should have left you to fend for yourself.
What?: I had to weave a little enchantment on the bees so I could get some honey, and I didn't feel up to using any more magic just yet. Anyway, I was in less danger than you'll be in today.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: So you were stealing their honey. They should have killed you.
What?: Come now. So much anger for such a little crime? Are you sure there is nothing else troubling you?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Excalibur! Is it true?
What?: The Lady of the Lake. Take it. Take it, quickly!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The knights of Galys approach the camp. It would be politic...
What?: ...to ride out and meet them.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: At your service, sir.
What?: Then answer me this. For years peace has reigned in the land. Crops grow in abundance, there is no want. Every one of my subjects enjoys his portion of happiness and justice, even those whose tiresome misunderstandings we must resolve here each day. Tell me, Merlin: have we defeated evil, as it seems?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Where hides evil, then, in my kingdom?
What?: Never where you expect it, that's all I know.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Merlin, tell me. Now that Guenevere is returned to me...
What?: What is it my child?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes.
What?: Just yes? No mad laughter, no riddles, nothing but a simple yes? That frightens me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What?  The greatest? They blend together like the metals we mix to make a good sword.
What?: I didn't ask for poetry. Which is it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I am alone and betrayed. By my wife, by my beloved friend, by my knights. And by you. Perhaps most of all by you. For you made me, you forged this wretched life. And like a child tired of a toy, you toss me aside, a babbling lecher trotting after my sister...
What?: That is my destiny. I have a destiny, too...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: With all your powers, you are content to be ridiculed, laughed at...
What?: My powers fade, Arthur. I resort to cheap tricks...  Yes! I enjoy every moment of my foolishness, I join in the making of it, so no one can betray me. But you! You betray yourself.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Me? I have lived by the oath of king and knight.
What?: You betray the boy who drew the sword, the boy who saw the Dragon... the Dragon who moves close by, coiling and uncoiling, restless, looking down, waiting for the King to be a king...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I must do it myself. I must kill them both. Lancelot and Guenevere. Will you ride with me, Merlin?
What?: I cannot. I must not. Here I must stay.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Quiet. You'll wake the men, and they must fight tomorrow for their very lives.
What?: I know. I have heard noises and echoes through the stones...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What is this place, Merlin?
What?: It is like a tree. The roots of the stones spread out across the land and they draw on the thoughts and actions of men. Like sap those human matters course through the stones feeding the stars that are the leaves of the tree. And the stars whisper back to men the future course of events.  But the earth is being torn apart, its metals stolen, and the balance is broken and the lines of power no longer converge. In fact, I nearly didn't make it in one piece.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But, I'm here.
What?: Where have you been these many years? Is it true that Morgana--

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: --Stories... You brought me back. Your love brought me back. Back to where you are now, in the land of dreams...
What?: Is this a dream? Tell me, Merlin!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Father...
What?: Rise, Mordred.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I have come to claim what is mine, Father.
What?: I recognize you only as my son, no more.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The very spear that pierced the side of Christ as he died on the cross.
What?: Your mother told you that?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I cannot offer you the land, only my love...
What?: And I offer only this, Father. To commit with passion and pleasure all the evils that you failed to commit, as man and king.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I will muster a great force of knights, and I will return to fight for what is mine.
What?: So be it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I left it in the tent, sir.
What?: Well hurry then, and get it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sir... Kay needed a sword. His was stolen. I saw Excalibur, and... I took it.
What?: You freed it, son?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Who is, then?
What?: I don't know. Merlin brought you to me when you were newly born and charged me to raise you as my own. At first, I did so because I feared Merlin, later because I loved you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He is the mightiest and fairest of knights.
What?: We fought and won battles, and now one man defeats all my knights? I will go.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It didn't hurt too much, did it?
What?: Ye...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But I have to leave tomorrow. The forests are thick with rebels, invaders plunder our shores...
What?: --And damsels in besieged castles are waiting to be rescued?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I didn't know Leondegrance had a daughter.
What?: Well, then, I shall tell you which knights have maiden daughters, so you can avoid their castles.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No, I think it's better if you just stay here to heal. At least a week.
What?: I'm going.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He must stay for the feasting days of our wedding, and tell his deeds himself.
What?: I grant you your wish if you grant Lady Guenevere hers.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I will ride with Sir Kay. Lancelot, rest here.
What?: Don't start a war on my wedding day!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sir Gahalt, answer the Queen.
What?: No. I meant not to be angry with you, Sir Gahalt. In the idleness that comes with peace gossip has bread its own evil. You merely repeat it. Please, sir, have one of those apples that Lancelot loves, and in that gesture partake of its goodness.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The Queen will be in my charge till a champion steps forward to fight on her behalf.
What?: Not you, my husband?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why can't you be my champion?
What?: If I am your judge, I cannot be your champion. When I act as your King, I cannot be your husband.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And you cannot love me...
What?: The laws, my laws, must bind everyone, high and low, or they are not laws at all. Lancelot will come...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I loved you much, as King, and sometimes as husband, but one cannot gaze too long at the sun in the sky.
What?: Forgive me, my wife, if you can. I was not born to live a man's life, but to be the stuff of future memory. The fellowship was a brief beginning, a fair time that cannot be forgotten

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Who does it serve?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I have waited long for you. Once you almost saw, but fear blinded you. Why am I served from the chalice?
What?: Because you and the land are one.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I am wasting away and I cannot die. And I cannot live.
What?: You and the land are one. Drink from the chalice. You will be reborn and the land with you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The well-kept secret is whether any of them has won your heart.
What?: No.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And there is no maiden in the whole world who inspires you?
What?: There is one.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Who?!
What?: You.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Me?
What?: Yes. I would swear my love to you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: To me? But why?
What?: I cannot love as a woman the lady who will be wife to my King and my friend. And, in pledging my love to you, I cannot love any other woman.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The law forbids it.
What?: Love demands it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: There are things about love--

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why didn't he kill us?
What?: He has given up.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The King without his sword, the land without a king...
What?: We are to blame.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Just a man. A knight in the King's service.
What?: You're a man?!  ...with metal skin!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Very well. Climb up.
What?: I will run.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Listen, boy, it's more than twenty days from here.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I have found you. The Queen. An apple. Tomorrow. Sir Gawain...
What?: --It must wait, child. These good ladies, for whom I intervened once, will honor me with a meal. I am beholden to them now as I was when they begged my protection.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You left your husband's side? You left your brother's wedding?
What?: Is that Mandrake, Lord Merlin?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It is.
What?: Can it truly be used for magic?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No, no, of course not. You are young...
What?: I'm not jealous!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's clear you are, and it irks me.
What?: No. Yes, I am. I am jealous. I want to write poems about you with moonbeams, make the sea sing your name...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: A lovestruck page!
What?: Shh... yes, yes. Sit with me, please... Morgana.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I showed you all my conjuring tricks...
What?: The deepest secrets, the forbidden formulas...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You know what I want. I want the secret of true magic, how to thicken the stuff of dreams and wishes with the flesh of the world.
What?: That I cannot.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: When Arthur built the castle, I carved out a place for myself, where I could laugh or sleep, and no one would bother me.
What?: People make you laugh?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They do.
What?: Why?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You are truly magnificent!
What?: Flattery! Do you think I am ignorant of your stupid little games? Preying on you weakness of others. That's your power, a petty evil. Mine is great. Great plans. Impossible dreams. Laughable endings...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Merlin, the powers of Summoning, the true Name of the charms of Doing and Undoing. Show me!
What?: I won't. You would misuse such power. I have paid enough for you, and I will have you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What do you want? You must desire it for me to weave it.
What?: Walls of shining crystals, burning with red fire, furnishings of metals and jewels never seen by man...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You provoke me, Merlin.
What?: What's behind that beauty? A wizened, cold-hearted snake.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I am the cloudburst that quenches the flames.
What?: I am the desert, where water disappears--

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: --I am the sea, which covers the desert forever under its weight.
What?: --I am the fog and mists that rise up from the sea, escaping...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's done. A truce. We meet at the river.
What?: Talk. Lovers murmuring to each other...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I should butcher all and every one of them. Merlin, what is this wagging of tongues?
What?: Just show the sword.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Behold the sword of power, Excalibur.
