Speak the words.
What?: One land, one king! That is my peace!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I have walked my way since the beginning of time. Sometimes I give, sometimes I take. It is mine to know which, and when.
What?: Dumb riddles, Merlin. I am your King.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I swear it. By Excalibur and the holy--
What?: --What issues from your lust will be mine. Swear it again.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Merlin! Out of the sick sleep at last.
What?: Doing what I did for you, it wasn't easy, you know. It takes it's toll. It took nine moons to get back my strength.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Now you must pay me.
What?: I?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The oath. You didn't say--
What?: You didn't ask!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's not for you, Uther, hearth and home, wife and child.
What?: To kill and be king, is that all?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Maybe not even that, Uther. I thought once that you were the one to unite the land under one sword. But it'll take another, a greater king...
What?: You strike me with words as hard as steel.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You too?  This holiday's about giving, Adelle.  And I'm giving everything I've got to this deal, so in a way, I'm more Christmassy than anyone...  Lifesaver?
What?: You're a ray of sunshine, Jack.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh, and Oxxford called...
What?: Ooh, my suits are ready...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Kate Reynolds...
What?: Her assistant said you could call her at home after eight.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Her assistant?
What?: Yeah Jack, her assistant...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Kate Reynolds was my girlfriend in college.  I almost married her...
What?: You?  Married?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Almost married.  And almost a junior broker at E.F. Hutton...
What?: Excuse me?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: She didn't want me to go to London.  We're standing at the airport saying goodbye and she asks me to stay.
What?: So you left her?  Just like that?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: God, no.  I thought about it for practically the entire flight...
What?: Stop Jack, I'm getting all weepy.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I took the road less traveled, Adelle.
What?: And look where it's led you...  I'm gonna get her on the phone...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No...
What?: No?!  You almost married this woman.  Aren't you even curious what she wants?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'll leave from the office tomorrow afternoon.  Call the group.  Schedule an emergency strategy session for noon.
What?: That'll be a nice little holiday treat.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Hello?
What?: Hey Santa, where are you? Everybodys here.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Adelle?
What?: You were supposed to be here half an hour ago...the emergency strategy session? Your trip to Aspen? Theyre all panicked here...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Sorry, Jack.  I told Dee and the kids I'd be home by dinner.  You know, it being Christmas Eve and all.
What?: Is that tonight?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You think I like being here on Christmas Eve, Alan?
What?: I don't know.  Maybe...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're right, Jack.  Sorry... Jack approaches Alan.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why Jack?
What?: Because my gift comes with ten zeroes at the end...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mr. Mintz.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You have kids, Jack?
What?: Uh...actually, yes. Two... good ones.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I was a sales associate, at E.F. Hutton.
What?: A broker? Really. And now youre in the tire business?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Thats right. And auto supply...
What?: Uh huh. The retail end, I understand.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Uh...we actually get about sixty percent of our business from automotive service.
What?: Mind if I ask what kind of sales you did last year? Ballpark...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We did one point seven million in total revenue...
What?: Uh huh...one point seven. And what do you project for this year?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well, Alan, I think were gonna have a banner year. Sales are up almost twenty percent in the first quarter and we just landed a major trucking company account.
What?: Really. So youre projecting what, a tad over two million?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Look, I know our paltry little two million in sales is about what you spend on office supplies in a year.  And I know some regional trucking company account is nothing compared to a sixty billion dollar merger...
What?: Im not trying to knock the tire business, Jack.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And I know people.
What?: Im sure you do...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Take you, for instance...
What?: What about me?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: ...thats our war room. We did seven major deals last year, three of them hostile.
What?: Seven.  Really.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Good for you. Why shouldnt you protect whats yours.

What?: Whats going on here?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Excuse me?
What?: But I think I like you better this way...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No.
What?: So what are we gonna do, Jack?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Rise...and...shine...!
What?: Youre jumping, sweetheart...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mom, dont you think we need to open the presents?
What?: Mommy needs five more minutes in la la land. That could be her present...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Were almost done here...
What?: Mary Janes, Mom.  You promised.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Fightings a part of it, Annie.  You know that, right?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They did a pretty good job.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The aliens...In the mother ship.  You look just like him.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Do you like kids?

What?: I think I could figure it out.

What?: Sure.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I have winter camp until four, then ballet until five thirty.
What?: Five thirty.  Okay.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Try not to be late because kids dont like to be the last one picked up.
What?: Got it.  Good tip.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Where do I go now?

What?: Like what?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: One year he had a solar system named after her...
What?: Dont you think thats a little gimmicky?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Maybe theres a jewelry store back at the mall. I could get her a pair of earrings or something.
What?: Thats good but...you did forget the anniversary.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Very nice. What is it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What are you doing?
What?: Ringing my bell...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Is it morning yet?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I know, I moved the Barca-lounger into the corner.  Its throwin everybody off.  What do you think?
What?: Great room...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Were friends, arent we?
What?: Maybe I dont say it enough but you moving in next door to me...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Im having kind of a bad day.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What am I saying?  You dont need to hear that...  All I meant was a lot of people have a hard time dealing with all the forced reverie, thats all.  Is that you?
What?: Is it...?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Trouble at work?
What?: I dont think so.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You see, its like were in each others heads...
What?: Kates my wife...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Look, you fit the profile exactly.  Thirties, house, kids, financial responsibilities.  You start thinking...this isnt the life I dreamt about. What?: Its just two kids, right?

What?: Jesus, Jack, this is a league match, for gods sake!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Wheres your follow through?  Wheres your stance?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Hey Jack, youre all flush.  I guess that seventy-one took a lot outta you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: She is relentless.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: She said that?
What?: Pretty much.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh yeah...  What is it about you?
What?: So could you write down her exact address?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Whoa...whoa...wait a second, Jack.  Youre not actually gonna cheat on Kate?
What?: It wouldnt really be cheating...  Its complicated.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What plans?
What?: I came to make peace with you, even if you're the father of lies. I want things to be as they were.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Stop pestering me then!
What?: Oh, Lestat. I must do more than that. I've brought a present for you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh, Claudia, you've outdone yourself. Where did you find them?
What?: Drunk on brandy wine. A thimblefull. I thought of you when I saw them.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Absinthe? You gave then absinthe?
What?: No. Laudanum.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Laudanum!
What?: Yes. It killed them, unfortunately. But it keeps the blood warm.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Don't Louis --
What?: Louis, put me in my coffin...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I want more.
What?: What have you done?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How did you learn to write, Claudia?
What?: The way I learn everything. By watching you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But you never let me see you kill, Louis.
What?: Lestat taught you all you need to know about that.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Infant death, he calls me. Sweet daughter death. You know what he calls you? Merciful death.
What?: He jests.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why does he call you that?
What?: Hush, Claudia don't talk about such things. Show me your book.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Claudia! You did that?
What?: Sit still. It's not finished -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You want me to be a doll forever?
What?: Claudia - don't -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We're immortal. You've always known that.
What?: Tell me why...you've got to tell me...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You see the old woman? That will never happen to you. You'll never grow old. You will never die.
What?: And it means something else too, doesn't it? I shall never, ever grow up.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You... fed on me?
What?: And he found me with you. I ran, sickened at what I'd done. Then he cut his wrist and fed you from him. I tried to stop him, but you were a vampire then. And have been every night hereafter.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You both did it?
What?: I took your life. He gave you another one.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But now's the time to end it, Louis. Now's the time to leave him.
What?: He'll never let us go.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Lestat. Oh, God forgive us.
What?: Don't mock me, Louis. Help me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He's dead, Claudia, dead.
What?: The one good lesson he taught me, Louis. Never drink from the dead.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Should we burn him? Bury him? What would he have liked, Louis?
What?: Don't mock, Claudia...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: In Europe, Louis. We shall meet our own kind. Find the one who made him. Learn what it means.
What?: And suppose the one who made him knows nothing and the vampire who made him knows nothing, and it goes back, nothing proceeding from nothing, until there is nothing! And we must live with the knowledge that there is no knowledge.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He belongs with those reptiles, Louis. He deserved to die.
What?: Then maybe so do we. Every night of our lives. He was my brother. My maker. He gave me this life, whatever it is.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Louis, look at me.
What?: I can't. Go away from me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You never talked to me like that - in all these years.
What?: And you never cried -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Hush, Claudia, hush now my dear -
What?: Tell me you don't hate me Louis. I did it for you -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What was that?
What?: The workmen must have a trunk - don't stop, cherie -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It can't be -
What?: It is! Take the back stairwell -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The ship is sailing wihout us!
What?: Not yet.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How do I look?
What?: Still my beautiful child.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: A beautiful child! Is that what you still think I am?
What?: Yes...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You want me to be your daughter forever, don't you?
What?: Yes.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You don't remember? Or you never knew.
What?: It was something hurries...and seldom savoured... something acute that was quickly lost. It was the pale shadow of killing.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Or her, or her - or any of them?
What?: Claudia, you torture yourself.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They are ducklings, that will grow into swans. Whereas I must be the duckling forever.
What?: You are more beautiful than any of them.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Are they my kind Louis? Dolls never change either.
What?: You are neither, Claudia. Now stop this --

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You know her?
What?: Yes. Should I take her, Louis? Among her dolls? make a doll of her in turn?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But this can't be real. This is nonsense.
What?: Nonsense all right. But something tell me it's going to be the strangest nonsense we've ever seen.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mortals, mortals everywhere. And lots of drops to drink.
What?: They are here. I know they are. Listen for something that doesn't make a sound.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They use no paint. And the audience think it is paint.
What?: How devilishly clever.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: She's no vampire.
What?: No. She's frightened. She doesn't know where she is.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: This is no performance.
What?: And no one knows but us...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: This is monstrous!
What?: Yes, and very beautiful.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I've seen enough of this! I loathe it!
What?: Be still!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I lothe them! I can't stand the sight of them! Stupid bourgeois Parisians, all dressed in black like some private club! I've searched for them the world over and I despise them!
What?: What danger?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Do you think I would let them harm you?
What?: No, you would not, Louis. Danger hold you to me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Love holds you to me. And we are in danger, not you.
What?: Love?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You would leave me for Armand if he beckoned you.
What?: Never.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He wants you as you want him. He's been waiting for you. He wants you for a companion. He bides his time that place. he finds them as dull and lifeless as we do.
What?: That's not so.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Do you know what his soul said to me without saying a word? When he put me in that trance...
What?: So you felt it too!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: He can protect us, Claudia.
What?: You really believe that?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How do we seem to you? Do you think us beautiful, magical, our white skin, our fierce eyes? Drink, you ask me! Have you any idea of the thing you will become?
What?: Your evil is that you cannot be evil! And I will suffer for it no longer!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Don't make me, Claudia! I cannot do it!
What?: Yet you could do it to me! Snatching me from my mother's hands like two monsters in a fairy-tale! Couldn't you have waited? Six more years and I would have had that shape! And now you weep! You haven't tears enough for what you've done to me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh God! I love you still, that's the torment of it. But you know I must leave you Louis...
What?: Yes...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: She is dying. It happened to you too, but your child's mind can't remember.
What?: But if she dies...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Bear me no ill will, my love. We are now even.
What?: What do you mean?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They would have killed you -
What?: Then my luck would have changed.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You want death? Is it death you want?
What?: Yes...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Who the hell are you? What are you doing in my house?
What?: And a beautiful house it is too. Yours is a good life, isn't it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're not afraid of anything, are you?
What?: Why should I be?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What do you want from me?
What?: I've come to answer your prayers. You want to die, don't you? Life has no meaning anymore, does it?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Diane!!!!
What?: They are gone, Louis. Death took them. Death which you can now destroy...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You have to ask me for this. You have to want it, do you hear me?
What?: Give it to me!!!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Vampires. We thrive on blood.
What?: I want it!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You let your overseer run riot, work your slaves to the bone. We'll start with him.
What?: How do you mean, start?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Let's call that a start.
What?: I can't do it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You've just done it -
What?: Kill me if you will, but I can't do this...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Don't worry. He was white trash, they come at two a penny. I dumped him in the swamp and untied the slave, licked his wounds clean.
What?: You're the devil, aren't you? That's who you are.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I wish I were. But if I were, what would I want with you?
What?: I can't go through with it, I tell you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Your perfect. Your bitter and you're strong.
What?: But why do you want me?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You really want to be with them?
What?: Yes. Kill me. Kill me like you promised -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Did I hear a yes?
What?: Yes...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're sure?
What?: Sure...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You're body's dying. Pay no attention. It will take twenty minutes at most.
What?: Dying?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Come, you're going to feed now.
What?: I want a woman.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Take him.
What?: The crucifix -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What have I done?
What?: You have fed. You were made for this...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Dear God, what have I done?
What?: You've killed Louis. And enjoyed it.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes, that's you, my handsome friend. And you'll look that way till the stars fall from heaven.
What?: It can't be...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You must get into it. It's the only safe place for you when the light comes.
What?: And if I don't?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You'll get used to killing. Just forget about that mortal coil. You'll become accustomed to things all too quickly.
What?: Do you think so?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I know. It gets cold so fast.
What?: We can live like this? Off the blood of animals?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: There's nothing in the world now that doesn't hold some...
What?: Fascination...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But we can live without taking human life. It's possible.
What?: Anything is possible. But just try it for a week. Come into New Orleans and let me show you some real sport!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Have you ever been caught?
What?: Of course not. It's so easy you almost feel sorry for them.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The trick is not to think about it. See that one? The widow St. Clair? she had that gorgeous young fop murder her husband. She's perfect for you. Go ahead.
What?: But how do you know?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Read her thoughts.
What?: I can't.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What have you done to me? You've condemned me to hell.
What?: I don't know any hell -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Consider yourself lucky. In Paris a vampire has to be clever for many reasons. Here all one needs is a pair of fangs.
What?: Paris? You came from Paris?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: As did the one who made me.
What?: Tell me about him. You must have lernt something from him! It had to happen for you as it did for me!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I learnt absolutely nothing. I wasn't give a choice, remember?
What?: But you must know something about the meaning of it all, you must know where we come from, why we...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: They know about us. They see us dine on empty plates and drink from empty glasses.
What?: Come the New Orleans then. There's an opera on tonight. A real french opera! We can dine in splendour!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I respect life, don't you see? For each and every human life I have respect.
What?: Respect me a little then. I'm the only life you know.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You fool, what have you done?
What?: What you wouldn't do. It's almost sunrise. It will be the sun or the fire. You said they can kill me. The sun or the fire!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Where are we?
What?: Where do you think, my idiot friend? We're in a nice filthy cemetery. Does this make you happy? Is this fitting and proper enough?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We belong in hell.
What?: And what if there is no hell, or they don't want us there? Ever think of that?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What, no flowery speeches? About what a monster I am? What a vulgar fiend?
What?: I'm not interested in you. You disgust me. I'm interested in my own nature and know I can't trust you to tell me the truth about me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What do you imagine you are Louis?
What?: I don't pretend to know.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Lestat, she's alive!!!!
What?: Vampires are killers. Predators, who's all seeing eyes were meant to give them detachment.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The girl, Lestat -
What?: I know. Let her alone.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why do you do this Lestat?
What?: I like to do it. I enjoy it. Take you aesthete's taste to purer things. Kill them swiftly if you will, but do it! For now doubt, you are a killer Louis. Ah!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Lestat - finish this -
What?: You finish her - if you feel so much -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Unless I make her one of us...
What?: NO!!!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: My God... to think you... are all I have to learn from...
What?: In the old world, they called it the dark gift, Louis. And I gave it to you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Pain is terrible for you. You feel it like no other creature because you are a vampire. You don't want it to go on.
What?: No...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Do what it is in your nature to do. And you will feel as you felt with that child in your arms.
What?: Oh God Lestat. I felt peace. I felt an end to the craving.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Evil is a point of view. God kills, indiscriminately, and so shall we. For no creatures under God are as we are, none so like him as ourselves.
What?: Is God merciless? Greedy and cruel?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: She's here, your wounded one.
What?: What are you saying?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Lestat!
What?: You remember how you wanted her, the taste of her -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I didn't want to kill her.
What?: Don't worry, Louis, you're conscience is clear. You left her alive.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Claudia, Claudia, listen to me. You're ill, my precious and I'm going to give you what you need to get well.
What?: Lestat, what do you mean?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You are the devil! You are the instrument of Satan!
What?: That's enough, cherie. Stop before the heart stops.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Your mama's left you with us. She wants you to be happy.
What?: You are the devil! You are the instrument of Satan!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Claudia, Claudia, will you never learn? Who will we get now to finish your dress? A little practicality, cherie...
What?: She would sleep in my coffin, daily, curl her child's fingers round my hair as she dreamt of I know not what...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Claudia! Don't do this thing!!!
What?: Louis, Louis, I gave you the gift --- help me ---

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No... You come back to me Louis...
What?: Are you mad????

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You'll come home with me Louis? Fro a little while... until I am myself again.
What?: CLAUDIA!!!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm so glad you're here Louis... I've dreamed of your coming...
What?: Don't try to speak... it's alright...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I didn't mean to let them do it... that Santiago, he tricked me...
What?: That's all past, Lestat.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Still beautiful Louis. You always were the strong one.
What?: Don't fear me, Lestat. I bring you no harm.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's only a siren...
What?: I can't bear it Louis! The machines out there, that fly and that roar! And such lights! They make the night brighter than the day!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And they frighten you?
What?: You know I love the dark. But there's no dark anymore.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's false light, Lestat. It can't harm you...
What?: If you stayed with me Louis, I could venture out... little by little... become the old Lestat.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I have to go now Lestat...
What?: You remember how I was, Louis.. the vampire Lestat...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I tried to tell you Louis... that night in Paris... when I first came to you... no-one can refuse the dark gift, Louis... not even you.
What?: I tried...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And the more you tried, the more I wanted you... a vampire with your beautiful, suffering human heart. And how you suffered... I need your forgiveness, Louis.
What?: You have it...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: So you want me to tell you the story of my life...
What?: That's what I do. I interview people. I collect lives. F.M. radio. F.F.R.C. I just interviewed a genuine hero, a cop who -

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You'd have to have a lot of tape for my story. I've had a very unusual life.
What?: So much the better. I've got a pocket full of tapes.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You followed me here, didn't you?
What?: Saw you in the street outside. You seemed interesting. Is this where you live?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: It's just a room...
What?: So shall we begin?  What do yo do?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: See? I knew you were interesting. You mean this literally, I take it?
What?: Absolutely. I was watching you watching me. I was waiting for you in that alleyway. And then you began to speak.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Well, what a lucky break for me.
What?: Perhaps lucky for both of us.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You were going to kill me? Drink my blood?
What?: Yes but you needn't worry about that now. Things change.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You believe this, don't you? That you're a vampire? You really think...
What?: We can't begin this way. Let me turn on the light.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But I thought vampires didn't like the light.
What?: We love it. I only wanted to prepare you.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: How did you do that?
What?: The same way you do it. A series of simple gestures. Only I moved too fast for you to see. I'm flesh and blood, you see. But not human. I haven't been human for two hundred years.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What can I do to put you at ease? Shall we begin like David Copperfield? I am born, I grow up. Or shall we begin when I was born to darkness, as I call it. That's really where we should start, don't you think?
What?: You're not lying to me, are you?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Why should I lie? 1791 was the year it happened. I was twenty-four - younger than you are now.
What?: Yes.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You said the slave had a crucifix...
What?: Oh, that rumour about crosses?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You can't look at them...
What?: Nonsense, my friend. I can look on anything I like. And I am particularly fond of looking on crucifixes.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: The story about stakes through the heart?
What?: The same. As you would say today... Bull shit.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What about coffins?
What?: Coffins... coffins unfortunately are a necessity...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You loved Yvette...
What?: Can a vampire feel love?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You loved your wife, surely.
What?: I was human then. Might as well ask can an angel feel love. Both are blesses or cursed with a certain... detachment. Though whether angels take as long to learn it as I, I will never know.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Shall we go on?
What?: He did it to make you stay with him!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But why did you tell her?
What?: How could I not? She had to know.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And did you lose her? Did she go?
What?: Where would she have gone? She was a child, and beautiful, heartbreaking merciless child. And I had made her that...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Did he die in the fire?
What?: He was dead to us. We were free. That was all that mattered.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You found nothing?
What?: Peasant rumours, superstitions about garlic, crosses, stakes in the hear, all that - how do you say again? Bull shit. But one of our kind? Not a whisper.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No vampires in Transylvania? No Count Dracula?
What?: Fictions, my friend. The vulgar fictions of a demented Irishman... So we repaired to Paris...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Lestat escaped the fire!
What?: He hadn't even been there. And all those years I thought he was dead.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: No... it can't end like that...
What?: But it has. There is no more to tell.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But you talk about passion, about longing, about things I'll never know in my life! It's still inside you, in every syllable you speak! And then you tell me it ends like that? Just empty?
What?: It's over, I'm telling you...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Is this what you want? You ask me for this after all I've told you?
What?: If I could see what you've seen, feel what you've felt I wouldn't let it end like this! You need a like to the world out there, a connection... then it won't end like this...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Dear God. I've failed again, haven't I?
What?: No...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You haven't the vaguest conception under God of what you ask!
What?: Au contraire, monsieur, I have.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You promise to care for her then?
What?: Yes...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Yes.
What?: What do you think she is, Madeleine? A doll?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: And the child who did die?
What?: My daughter...

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Look at the gaslight. Don't tke your eyes off it. You will be drained to the point of death, but you must stay alive. Do you hear me?
What?: Yes!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I'm not crying, Mr. Potter.
What?: Well, you're begging, and that's a whole lot worse.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Times are bad, Mr. Potter. A lot of these people are out of work.
What?: Then foreclose!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: But they're somebody's children.
What?: Are you running a business or a charity ward?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mr. Potter, what makes you such a hard-skulled character? You have no family  no children. You can't begin to spend all the money you've got.
What?: So I suppose I should give it to miserable failures like you and that idiot brother of yours to spend for me.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Hey, this is the company's posters, and the company won't like this.
What?: How would you like to get a ticket next week? Haven't you any romance in you?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Come on, we got to get this up. He's coming.
What?: Who?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Get that ladder up here.
What?: All right  all right.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Hurry up . . . hurry up . . . hurry up.
What?: I'm hurrying.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: George . . .
What?: Ernie, I'm a rich tourist today. How about driving me home in style?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: All right, put up your hands. No fast moves. Come on out here, both of you.
What?: Bert! Thank heaven you're here!

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Stand back.
What?: Bert, what's happened to this house? Where's Mary? Where's my kids?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Bert, now listen to me. Ernie, will you take me over to my mother's house? Bert, listen!  It's that fellow there  he says he's an angel  he's tried to hypnotize me.
What?: I hate to do this, fella.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What the Sam Hill you yelling for, George?
What?: Don't . . . George?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Know you? Are you kiddin'? I've been looking all over town trying to find you. I saw your car piled into that tree down there, and I thought maybe . . . Hey, your mouth's bleeding
What?: What did . . .

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Good morning, sir.
What?: Carter  bank examiner.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Mr. Carter, Merry Christmas.
What?: Merry Christmas.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: We're all excited around here.  My brother just got the Congressional Medal of Honor. The President just decorated him.
What?: Well, I guess they do those things. Well, I trust you had a good year.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Good year? Well, between you and me, Mr. Carter, we're broke.
What?: Yeah, very funny.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: You what? To save me?
What?: Well, I did, didn't I? You didn't go through with it, did you?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Go through with what?
What?: Suicide.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh, I know all about you. I've watched you grow up from a little boy.
What?: What are you, a mind reader or something?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh, no.
What?: Well, who are you, then?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Clarence Odbody, A-S-2.
What?: Odbody . . . A-S-2. What's that A-S-2?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: That's what I was sent down for. I'm your guardian angel.
What?: I wouldn't be a bit surprised.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I told you  I'm your guardian angel. I know everything about you.
What?: Well, you look about like the kind of an angel I'd get. Sort of a fallen angel, aren't you? What happened to your wings?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: I haven't won my wings yet. That's why I'm an angel Second Class.
What?: I don't know whether I like it very much being seen around with an angel without any wings.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: By letting me help you.
What?: Only one way you can help me. You don't happen to have eight thousand bucks on you?

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh, no, no. We don't use money in Heaven.
What?: Oh, that's right, I keep forgetting. Comes in pretty handy down here, bub.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: Oh, tut, tut, tut.
What?: I found it out a little late. I'm worth more dead than alive.

Don't you think it kind of defeats the: What'd you say?
